message+desc:
Let‚Äôs leave the time of the Kingdom of Ryukyu!
‚ÄúRyukyu‚Äù is the old name of Okinawa and the biggest autumn festival in Okinawa Prefecture, ‚ÄúShurijo Castle Festival,‚Äù is held from October 31st to November 3rd. 
In this festival, you can experience culture of the Kingdom of Ryukyu which had existed from the 15th to the 19th century.
On November 2nd, the huge parade of 700 people in ancient costumes will be held. The parade replays the Kingdom of the old time and each day during the festival, traditional ‚ÄúRyukyu Dance‚Äù by women is shown. The dance called ‚ÄúRyukyu Buyo‚Äù expresses women‚Äôs emotions and feelings towards the cherished one.

[Access]
From Tokyo: about 2 and half hours by plane from Narita/Haneda Airport or little more than 2 hours from Osaka/KIX to Naha (Okinawa) Airport.
From Naha Airport: about 30mins by monorail to the Shurijo Castle.

Related Information
Shurijo Castle Festival: http://oki-park.jp.e.ms.hp.transer.com/shurijo/event/182
Historical Festivals: http://en.okinawastory.jp/learn/festivals/h_festivals/
Okinawa: http://www.jnto.go.jp/eng/location/regional/okinawa/

message+desc: If you could ask only ONE question about Korea and Korean culture, what would it be?*^^*
comments:
Me? I would like to ask how can I master Korean languages? I mean HanGul$$What is the story of Dokdo to the common Korean on the streets?$$Is there any place to visit without admission fee ;) ?$$Where is Namsan Tower?$$Why is the Korean entertainment industry so popular? As in it is popular to be working in the art industry.

For korean culture, I want to know if blood type really matters!$$What is the most favorite food among the korean peoples n why is it?$$What is the m0st p0pular place in K0rea ???$$How does the younger generation greet their elders?$$How do people connect with their traditional and contemporary life and culture of Korea to define a perfect combo of being an Korean..??$$Has the Korean entertainment industry ever have/had someone from the Filipino culture be part of it?

As for culture, why is it important for a person to know his/her blood type?$$I heard that Korean people dislike South east Asia people like myanmar,indonesia,thailand,filiphina etc..is that true?$$where does teen top live?$$How do parents in korea train their children to respect their elders..?$$Is this true that korean have different social class ? I"m refering to secret garden drama.$$what makes korea very popular to everyone across the world?$$Why is it so easy to say ÏÇ¨ÎûëÌï¥Ïöî to anyone? What would that phrase mean when you're saying it to the one that you really love as compared to a friend? How do Koreans differentiate that?$$what do koreans think about foreigners and interracial marriage?!$$Why korean doesn't use hanja anymore? Based on my experience with japanese, if korean use hangul & hanja together, it's easier to understand korean language... In my opinion..$$how do koreans pay rent of $3000 a month (average) when they only make $1000/month?

message+desc:
The Tray of Togetherness is a customary Chinese New Year snack assortment that features eight types of goodies (eight is a lucky number in Chinese tradition)!

Treats can include: preserved kumquats for prosperity, coconut for togetherness, and red melon seeds for happiness #FoodieFriday
comments: This is my favourite part of Chinese New Year! ~Natalie~$$Wow! I've eaten the milk candies when I was a little kid. My Dad has been to 132 countries (on work assignments), and he's traveled numerous times to China. He bought the significant milk candies back on one such Chinese business trip and shared them with me. Thanks Dad for opening up my eyes to new worlds as a child. <3

message+desc:
Where is it?
Albay, Bicol 

What is it?
Mostly known as the home of the iconic Mayon Volcano, Albay also offers a slew of nature parks and ruins from past eruptions of the famous volcano.

Fun Fact:
The fertile lands of Albay makes agriculture one of the province's main source of income as they produce crops like coconut, rice, sugar, and abaca. A great souvenir from this province would be a sample of their fine abaca made products like bags, hats, and mats.

Photo by: Rommel Natanauan

message+desc:
Where is it?
Coron, Palawan

How to Get There:
Fly from Manila to Busuanga, then transfer to a van bound for Coron.

What is it?
Coron is a first-class municipality in Palawan known for its beaches and shipwreck dive spots.

Fun Fact:
Tamilok -- shipworm dipped still-wriggling in spice vinegar -- is a local delicacy. Extreme foodie Andrew Zimmern had some on his television show, Bizarre Foods!

Photo by Adrien Uichico

message+desc:
A UNESCO World Heritage site, Champaner-Pavagadh, in #Gujarat, is known for its splendid monuments, temples, mosques, pavilions, lakes, mansions and fortifications. 

Situated 50 km north of Vadodara, Champaner-Pavagadh has 114 magnificent monuments, 38 of which are protected by the Archaeological Survey of India (ASI). It is also one of the few medieval heritage sites in India that showcases a unique combination of Islamic & Hindu architecture.
comments: Maya Nanji .....thought you would be interested in this. Have you seen this?$$Hiii Tricia, i haven't seen it but I really like historical places$$Have seen.. Beautiful place..

message+desc:
On June 8th, Chagu Chagu Umako Horse Festival which is famous as early summer tradition will be held in Iwate Pref.„ÄÄAbout 100 horses parade about 15 km from Onikoshi Sozen Shrine in Takizawa village to Morioka Hachimangu Shrine in Morioka city.„ÄÄ"Umako" is a diminutive form of horses and the horses wear colored harnesses and lots of bells.„ÄÄ"Chagu Chagu" is an onomatopoeic expression for the bells and the sound was selected as the 100 best sonic scenes of Japan to be preserved into the future. Visit to enjoy the sound and early summer tradition in Iwate!
 
More details: http://www.jnto.go.jp/eng/location/spot/festival/chaguchaguumako.html

message+desc:
Where is it?
Cagayan de Oro 

How to Get There:
"Fly from Manila to Cagayan de Oro.

Or take a boat from Manila, Iloilo, or Cebu to Cagayan de Oro."

What is it?
Whitewater rafting in the Philippines started in Cagayan de Oro City, the country's "Adventure Capital," in 1995. It was just a hobby for Rupert Domingo and Julius Bioco, but it flourished into a thrilling endeavour ‚Äì not just for themselves, but for other adventure-seekers as well. The two spent a decade surveying and crossing the river, painstakingly mastering its shape and channels. Now, tourists rely on their group's rafting expertise for an unforgettable adventure along the Cagayan River.

Fun Fact:
The 23 rapids of Cagayan River have names. Some are funny, and some are intimidating ‚Äì Elephant, Letter L, Letter S, Cloud 10, I'm Busy, Twister, 360, Surprise, Kiss The Wall, Braves Way, Rodeo, etc.

Photo by / Headline by:
Edgar Yap / Tin Sanchez
comments: yes  water rufting...i reall love it too.....$$When I was a teenager! We always play in this river!!$$We ride in a bamboo tree as our rafting!!

When  Australian travel blogger Alexander Sherack was asked what he hates most about the Philippines, he said: ‚ÄúLeaving. If you‚Äôve ever met someone that‚Äôs travelled through the Philippines, I guarantee that person will beg you to visit the Philippines. It‚Äôs a weird phenomenon but everyone I have met who travelled to this country have said it has been a highlight of any country they‚Äôve ever been to. Funnily enough, now I beg my friends to visit.‚Äù 

To read more on why Alexander loves the Philippines, click the link below!

message+desc:
Malaiyo is a delicious, frothy, creamy dessert available in Benaras especially during the winters. It is primarily flavored milk foam/froth garnished with pistachios and almonds. This winter sweet is served in a small earthen bowl. 
Have a mouthful of Malaiyo and give your taste buds a fabulous treat.
comments: I have never visited Benaras but this is it. Now Benaras on my bucket list of "must visit" places

message+desc:
Train travel is another great way to enjoy the spring scenery.
Starting April 12, there will be two new trains from Korail ‚Äî the O-train and V-train‚Äî running along a circular trail stretching across three provinces (Gangwon, North Gyeongsang, and North Chungcheong provinces).

The O-train is equipped with four different themed carriages, while the V-train, is a train where visitors can poke out their heads from windows to view the outside scenery.

More about the routes and schedules ‚Üí http://bit.ly/XRY7SK

message+desc:
Where is it?
Calauit Island, Coron

How to Get There:
Fly to Busuanga/Coron, Palawan then take a boat to Calauit Island. 

What is it?
The 3,700 hectare Calauit Island Wildlife Sanctuary brings together imported Kenyan and endemic Philippine species of wild game in rugged natural forests, grasslands, and mangrove swamps. Probably the only place on earth you can see a Kenyan topi grazing alongside the Palawan peacock!

Fun Fact:
The wildlife park was started by former Philippine president Ferdinand E. Marcos as part of a global initiative to help conserve African wildlife in the midst of civil unrest.

message+desc:
Where is it? 
Anilao, Batangas

What is it like? 
Soft corals prefer nutrient-rich waters and less light. They may look like plants, but corals are marine animals that need food. And this type feeds on zooplankton, or organisms incapable of swimming against a current ‚Äì making it the ideal treat for hungry marine creatures. You can find soft corals in Anilao's colorful underwater gardens, which are home to all sorts of tropical fish.

Fun Fact: 
Some soft corals are not actually soft. They're more tree-like and flexible, and can dance gracefully in the waves.

Photo by/Author: 
Tanya Burnett/Tin Sanchez
comments: Sarap...mag dive. ..d ko mlilimutan..still in top 10 dive sites in Philippines ^^$$15 min from my house. My relatives own Aguila Beach, famous for diving

message+desc:
Matcha is the tea used in "Sado", the traditional Japanese tea ceremony.  
It is made of dried green tea leaves that have been ground into a fine powder. This powder is then dissolved in hot water and stirred thoroughly, making a delicious foam on top. Matcha is also used in traditional Japanese confections and various savory dishes!

Learn more:
http://www.jnto.go.jp/eng/indepth/cultural/experience/f.html
http://www.jnto.go.jp/eng/indepth/cultural/hj/matcha.html
http://japan-magazine.jnto.go.jp/en/1605_teaceremony.html
comments:
As a matcha student and vendor, allow me to make 2 suggested changes to your post:
1) matcha does not dissolve, it remains in suspension, 2) matcha needs to be whipped, not stirred).
Www.chajin-online.com

Beppu City in Oita prefecture is widely regarded as the country‚Äôs onsen town and is home to some of the most popular and interesting hot springs in all of Japan. There are many charming, natural spring baths concentrated in the area. Visitors can experience unique hot springs only found in Beppu, such as the red and blue colored "Blood Pond Hell" and "Sea Hell" onsen, as well as 8 hot spring sites with hundreds of hot springs to choose from. Why not visit them in the expert company of a local guide? You‚Äôll be an onsen pro in no time!
Learn more: http://japan-magazine.jnto.go.jp/en/special_ana005.html

message+desc:
Part of the Marine Heritage Park, Sangalaki Island is one of the richest diving grounds in Indonesia. The uninhabited island which is part of Derawan Archipelago is surrounded by a wide lagoon and shallow reefs extending well out to sea. The currents vary from gentle to moderately strong; there‚Äôs no walls and little drift, just an abundance of rare and exotic marine life, including giant turtles and the famous schools of Manta rays or devil-fish. All in all, Sangalaki Island is the easiest place to see Manta rays during the day and sea turtle at night. 

#WonderfulIndonesia #PesonaIndonesia
comments: I was there last June, it's an amazing place!$$Where is sangalaki Island in indon√©sian? How to get there ?$$Wish could be there someday with my family$$Beautiful... one day I'll be there

message+desc:
Bolangir - Serenity combines with old-world charm

Once the capital of the princely state of Patnagarh, the district town of Bolangir, also spelt Balangir, still retains its old world‚Äôs charm and serenity.One of the major commercial towns in the western part of Odisha, the place is littered with the remnants of the past. 

What makes Bolangir a compelling travel destination is its scenic beauty, numerous shrines and the native tribal life. Driving through a thick forest cover to reach any place of interests is a rewarding experience. Many visitors use the town as a base to several places of interest located in the district. Traditional hand-woven textiles life will allure the ethnic tourists. 

- See more at: http://www.incredibleindia.org/travel/destination/bolangir
comments:
We made an online booking of two rooms for two nights in KSTDC Hotel Mayura Pine Top at Nandi Hills on 26.06.2015 and 27.06.2015. We stay at Kolkata. My son works in Bangalore. We went to Bangalore for two weeks. So, we hoped that we would enjoy a quite stay for two nights in this place, as it was very close to Bangalore, only 60 kms away. 
Nandi Hills is about 4500 ft high. Hotel Pine Top is situated in a beautiful place on the hill top in an isolated place. We reached the hotel at about 17 hrs in the dusk of 26.06.2015, by climbing a serpentine hilly road and became exited to enjoy the coming nights. 
When we arrived at the reception desk of Hotel Pine Top, we found that there were some hotel personnel seated near the entrance and some guests were enjoying evening tea and snacks in adjacent dining room. On the way, we also noticed a lot of parked cars, as it was Friday, the beginning of a weekend. 
We informed the hotel personnel that we had room bookings. They advised us to wait, but none came forward. After a while, one person moved to us. We told him that we had prior booking and showed him the reservation voucher. He called another person, who took our luggage, guided us to downstairs and opened two rooms. Rooms were two stories below the reception and one would have to climb down by the stairs by the side of the building. It was drizzling and the sky was extremely cloudy.
The rooms were glass-fitted with open front view of the valley. The view was really superb. There were steps to go down to a garden. From there, vast valley was being seen. The place was really calm and quite. There was a half-circle view-point in the complex, in the same level of reception, from where the view was more wide open.
But we could not stay. When we reached the reception, we found that everyone was disliking our presence. No one greeted us, as if we were non-invitees. No one was coming forward to speak with us. The person, who moved to us informed that there was no room available. No welcome message. Later we found that there was no other boarder beside us. When we informed that we had prior reservation, he told with a stoned face that there was shortage of water and electricity, as it was a hilly area. Might be. Then came the next point. We would have to take dinner within 7 PM, as there would no electricity after 7 PM. Water would be not available after 7 PM, 
We, however, accepted the proposal as we had nothing to do and nowhere to go. But, when the rooms were opened for us, no electricity was present in the rooms. Then we found no water in the tap in the bathrooms with lots of cockroaches in the rooms and bathrooms. Rooms were not clean and linens were not fresh and at some places dirty. It was becoming dark and we were horrified to find that big rats were moving freely inside the rooms and bathrooms. Street dogs were freely circling in the corridor and garden. We also came to know that mobile network would not work there. We were puzzled to think what to do in that evening. However, we decided not to stay in that horrible place. There was also no telephone connection between the rooms and the reception upstairs. So, at night, if there would be any emergency, we would find our way through rodents and dogs to go to reception upstairs, might be no one would be available there. After a good thought, we did not take any risk to stay there. Luckily, Bangalore was not far away.
We came back to the reception with our luggage and asked for the complaint book. When we told the hotel personnel that we would not stay, none asked us the reason, as if it was a better decision. We also noticed that in the complaint register, there were similar complaints by the previous boarders/customers, but KSTDC took no step. We wrote our grievances in the complaint register, but till date, no official from KSTDC/Karnataka Government telephoned us or made any query. We understood that though we noticed a lot of cars, all those people would return back to Bangalore in the evening and none would stay there at night. But we came from Kolkata,a far away place, to enjoy and were cheated. Probably, KSTDC/Karnataka Government does not have time to bother in such petty matter.
On our way back to Bangalore, we found other nearby hotels/resorts/lodges with electricity arrangements. We toured to other hilly remote places, even in high altitude, where supply of power were arranged at least upto 9/10 pm. Nandi Hills is a very good place for 1-2 nights stay, as it is very near to Bangalore. We could not understand why Karnataka Government was not developing the place. The hotel is beautifully placed, rooms are not bad, a big restaurant is attached, approachable road is there and lots of tourists come to this place. Only some developments, like electricity, water and mobile tower, are to be made. Then many other hoteliers will be interested to come to this place and the place will turn into a hot tourist spot. It is a good business opportunity for the local Government and also an avenue for development of local people. Instead of improving the place, KSTDC is charging higher for the weekends. The tariff of a double-bedded room was Rs.1150 in normal weekdays, whereas in the weekend it would jump to Rs.1500, which we had to pay in full. We felt very sorry that we could not enjoy this beautiful place. State Government is turning a deaf ear to the complaints made by the past boarders/customers, as the hotel personnel should inform the authorities that we left the hotel without staying. It was a case of cheating in the part of Karnataka Government. It is known to common people like us that the hotels/lodges run by Government/state bodies are safer and better places than the private ones.
We hope that Karnataka Government/KSTDC should be ashamed for charging boarders/customers without giving any normal basic amenities and should make booking after developing the hotel and area.

http://www.tripadvisor.in/ShowUserReviews-g2289003-d3428129-r306536195-Hotel_Mayura_Pine_Top_Nandi_Hills-Nandigunda_Karnataka.html#

message+desc:
One of our staff members went to Oshino Hakkai in Yamanashi Pref. this weekend. The weather was perfect to enjoy Mt. Fuji!
Oshino Hakkai is the name given to the 8 ponds filled with melted snow water that has taken long time to filter through the underground layers of Mt. Fuji.
The nearby museum (Shiryokan) was a great find, not so crowded and could take the best shot of Mt. Fuji and old houses like this picture!
More information about the area:
http://www.jnto.go.jp/eng/indepth/scenic/mtfuji/fuji_03.html

message+desc:
What dim sum is the best test of a chef‚Äôs skills? 
1. Shrimp dumpling
2. Macaroni and cheese
3. Soup Dumpling

Ans: No. 3. Order the soup dumpling to see if your dim sum chef can walk the walk. Inspired by a soup-inside-a-bun dish in Northern China, this dim sum is a pork dumpling with hot soup inside. The trick is serving it without letting the soup break through the skin. Soup dumpling ‚Äì the dim sum that makes or breaks a chef.
comments: Ans: No. 3. Order the soup dumpling to see if your dim sum chef can walk the walk. Inspired by a soup-inside-a-bun dish in Northern China, this dim sum is a pork dumpling with hot soup inside. The trick is serving it without letting the soup break through the skin. Soup dumpling ‚Äì the dim sum that makes or breaks a chef.$$Macaroni and cheese is not really a HK-type of dumpling, let alone Chinese. For the record, cheese is not even an ingredient of Chinese dumpling. So, between shrimp / soup dumpling, I would say soup dumpling.$$Since I and my husband moved to Korea, don't know when we can enjoy the dim sum again.

message+desc:
Where is it?
Stilts Resorts, Batangas

What is it?
Stilts is a resort in Calatagan, Batangas with eight cottages perched over water. Each cottage has a wooden staircase that leads right into the water, so you can dive right in!

Fun Fact:
This resort was inspired by pre-colonial natives that used to build their houses above water.

Photo by / Headline by:
Miguel Teotico / Rachel Teotico

message+desc:
Cuyo Island is the largest island of the Cuyo Archipelago. Aside from its beaches of fine sand and clear waters, Cuyo Island is home to  one of the most ancient and unique forts in the Philippines: The Cuyo Fort, built by the Spanish missionaries in 1680. Today Cuyo Island is slowly gaining popularity as an ideal windsurfing and kitboarding spot. 

Photo taken from ambot-ah.com

(people riding on the roof of a bus, 5 people on a motorcycle, ect. )$$Can you relate or have you seen these type of people on your night bus trips? message+desc: The captivating island of Belitung off the south eastern coast of Sumatra is set to hold the exciting Rainbow Troops Festival 2016 from 21 ‚Äì 23 October 2016. Inspired by renowned Indonesian writer Andrea Hirata, author of The Rainbow Troops, the festival will showcase a wide variety of traditional and contemporary dance and musical performances, and a festive cultural parade. This event will coincide with the arrival of yachts in the Sail Karimata Rally and in the Sail Indonesia and Sail2Indonesia boat rallies from Australia. #WonderfulIndonesiaTurning the spotlight to the beautiful island of Belitung in the province of Bangka-Belitung off the south eastern coast of Sumatra, the Land of the Rainbow Troops Festival will be held from 21st to 23rd October 2016 at Tanjung Pandan, capital city of Belitung Regency.
comments: This looks like such an amazing festival!

message+desc:
Lawang Sewu is a landmark in Semarang, Central Java, Indonesia, built as the headquarters of the Dutch East Indies Railway Company. The name of Lawang Sewu is from Javanese which means ‚ÄúThousand Doors‚Äù. The name comes from its design, which contains numerous doors and arcs, it‚Äôs about 600 large windows. Designed by Cosman Citroen, the colonial era building is famous as a haunted house, though the Semarang city government has attempted to rebrand it as a place for social and cultural activities. One of it was by renovating the building. Nowadays, Lawang Sewu attracted thousands of visitors on average each day.

#WonderfulIndonesia #PesonaIndonesia
comments: we have been here a month ago. Whoever   plan to visit Semarang, please take a moment and go this beauriful landmark called Lawang Sewu. Don't miss it.$$I have been here at night. Scary and nice experience

message+desc:
What makes your Christmas distinctly Pinoy? Is it the belen (nativity scene display)? The plastic Christmas tree? The smell of queso de bola (cheese ball)? Check out the list below and tell us if you agree or not! 

http://spot.ph/newsfeatures/humor/64273/10-unforgettable-pinoy-christmas-household-staplesYou know, other than a plastic Christmas tree
comments: For me, the lingering memories of Christmas consist if the delicious scent of steaming chocolate being brewed by my mother, the queso de bola, sweet ham, macaroni salad, grapes and castanas on the table, and a family getting around it all during noche buena. Of course, also the smell and taste of puto bungbong and bibingka eaten with a cup of hot tea after the daily midnight mass; and the Christmas carols I sing with my friends!

Hirosaki is lovely castle town, and it‚Äôs wonderful place to enjoy Sakura!

message+desc:
Leh-Ladakh - The Land of Endless Discovery

Set in Himalayan mountain splendor, Ladakh is an enchanted land, which amid the global chaos of our new century, seems in control of its own destiny. The scenic splendor of the soaring mountains and pristine valleys, coupled with the vibrancy of its cultural life, makes Ladakh one of the last undiscovered destinations; an adventure to feed the soul and enrich the senses. 

With the iconic sight of Hemis Monastery, 47 km from the capital Leh on the west bank of the Indus, under its belt, the place is famous for nine-storey palace built by King Singge Namgyal in the grand tradition of Tibetan architecture. An exceptional destination for adventurous travelers, the area has a wide array of trekking routes too. 

- See more at: http://www.incredibleindia.org/travel/destination/leh-ladakh
comments: Places to visit in Jaipur. You're in it! http://bit.ly/1ES2KqH

message+desc:
Where is it?
Pamilacan Island, Bohol

How to Get There:
"Fly from Manila to Tagbilaran.

Or take the Roll-On Roll-Off (RORO) ferry from Cebu to Tagbilaran.

Or take a boat from Cebu or any of the major cities in Mindanao to Tagbilaran.

Then take a van, jeepney or tricycle to Panglao Island."

What is it?
This small, beautiful island is just a short boat ride away from the Baclayon pier. It‚Äôs famous for dolphin and whale-watching, so time your trip during the months these animals are most active.

Fun Fact:
There are ruins of an ancient Spanish fort on the island.

Photo by / Headline by:
Meggy De Guzman
comments: been coming here for a long time and its a beautiful  place  people are great never been to a resort just provinces and the beauty u see is spectacular$$Too bad you can't stay long here in Visayas. message+desc:
Dining with sand on your feet? That‚Äôs old news! How about dining next to a waterfall? Check out Travel and Leisure‚Äôs feature of our very own Labassin Waterfall Restaurant in Villa Escudero, Tiaong Quezon.  

http://www.travelandleisure.com/food-drink/restaurants/restaurant-in-waterfall?xid=soc_socialflow_facebook_tlThe Labassin Waterfall Restaurant in the Philippines is literally perched at the foot of a flowing waterfall. Read on.

Nice in pictures but in reality there are flies all over specially around the food. And the walk to the tables is dangerously slippery.  Been there with family, not inclined to go back.$$Villa Escudero well worth a visit, not just for a day trip but for a overnight stay in one of the Riverside Villasüëç$$This picture does not do the place justice. Being there 5 years ago was amazing.
Yes there were Flies and Mosquitos and not so fresh water upstream, if you ventured that way, but in the immediate vicinity of the water fall it was very clean, clear water and no insects.
Well worth spending a day there.$$It's great and no flies when I visited as mentioned by another. Fantastic place to visit.$$Been there done that the only restaurant where you can sit down for a meal and wash your hands and feet at the same time only in the philippines!$$It's pretty clean actually. message+desc:
Cape Kri is one of popular dive sites in Raja Ampat. There is a good chance to spot giant groupers and huge school of fish. The coral formations are impressive and extremely diverse. In the shallows, there are nudibranches and different kind of scorpion fish. 
"On my last trip to Raja Ampat, I recorded 283 fish species during a single dive near the Kri Island resorts. This is the most fishes ever seen on a single dive over a career spanning almost 30 years," Dr. Gerald R. Allen, Marine Biologist and a well-known author of marine‚Äôs books.

#WonderfulIndonesia #PesonaIndonesia
comments: Join with us came to travelthinks in facebook

message+desc:

Sorry, but  isnt that nazi's symbol? omg. really sorry ._.$$In eastern teachings swastika means eternity or higher being while during WW II Hitler's Arian movement meant what it the world has become to known it as much twisted & malevolent value to such a peaceful symbol!$$The swastika was the symbol of good fortune, prosperity, and longevity in many Far Eastern countries. The word swastika comes from the Sanskrit svasti, which means good fortune, luck, and well-being. In Buddhism, the swastika represents the turning of the ‚ÄúDharma wheel‚Äù, and thereby promotes goodwill, compassion, and generosity to all sentient beings. Regrettably, Adolf Hitler and the National Socialist German Workers Party borrowed the swastika in the early 1900s, reversed it, and used it as their party emblem during World War II. Not only do the Nazi swastika and the ancient swastika used in Buddhism and Eastern cultures differ in meaning, the Nazi swastika is also slanted, resting on a point, and has right angles bent in a clockwise direction. message+desc:
Where is it?
Coron, Palawan

How to Get There:
Fly from Manila to Busuanga, then transfer to a van bound for Coron.

What is it?
Coron is a first-class municipality in Palawan known for its beaches and shipwreck dive spots.

Fun Fact:
Tamilok -- shipworm dipped still-wriggling in spice vinegar -- is a local delicacy.  Extreme foodie Andrew Zimmern had some on his television show, Bizarre Foods!

Photo by Adrien Uichico

message+desc:
Have you decided how and where to spend year-end and new year holidays?
 
In Japan, we have some customs to do during the holiday season.
A popular custom is eating "Toshikoshi-soba" on New Year's Eve for good luck.
The reason why many people in Japan eat "Soba" on the day is that we wish for long and healthy life like soba (buckwheat) noodles. „ÄÄPlease visit Japan and find out our other customs during the holiday season!
More New Year‚Äôs Events: http://www.jnto.go.jp/eng/indepth/exotic/JapanesQue/1212/newyear.html
http://www.jnto.go.jp/eng/indepth/cultural/experience/ab.html

message+desc:
Wedding Ang Pow Rates Increase To $234/ Pax.

But guests should not be pressured or obligated to give more money just because it is hosted at a five-star hotel.

Here‚Äôs why.

http://mustsharenews.com/wedding-angpow-rate/Here is why you should not feel pressured into giving a big red packet when you are attending a wedding dinner at a high-class place!
comments:
Red packets are a gift by the guest to the wedding couple. Don't turn it into a profit making business. It's your choice to choose an expensive location, it is my liberty to give a 'gift' that I can afford and reflecting my economic ability at the moment. It's a wedding invitation, not a Ticketed dinner event.$$Because Singaporean are being considerate as friends, neighbors and relatives. And because Singaporean fear losing "Face Water", some takes advantage of the situation. 

However, I have a friend (very wealthy himself) told his son (who was about to be married), do not expect the invited guests to keep up with amount in angpows since the wedding was held at top class hotel. And that should be rightfully so. Friends, neighbors and relatives should only present a wedding gifts they meant to be and affordable.$$Every couple wants the best,parents want to please relatives and friends to save face for themselves as well as for the newly web couple.
Remember the package include a lot of other expenses in which the Hotel/Restataunts/Event companies put in.
Actually based on the food alone it should not worth that much.
$800-$1000 is consider high.
So your red package should not be more than $280 per couple or $120 per person.
It is the real market rate.$$Well said.  It is a vicious cycle.  Give whatever you feel comfortable in giving as it is only a blessing and not fair for you to foot the couple's wedding dinner bill. 

Anyway, nowadays, eating less is more healthy. I suggest consider a 4 course dinner instead of a 8 course dinner will halve the cost of hosting the event or consider a buffet,  $10 per pax can help stretch $5,000 to feed 500 guests or 50 tables.$$If you do not have a big head, please do not attempt to wear a big hat which doesn't fit. (Chinese proverb)

Traditional wedding dinners are such a bore! Yawns!$$Someone I got to know invited me to his daughter's wedding - as a group of friends we all attended and each gave red packet - one check the hotel and call to find out how much the table will cost and divide by ten of us -  $100 each - later I heard his Son in law gave him a couple of tables and he made the money himself from the angpows he collect - what a shrewd oldman he was.$$Want to have face hosting wedding dinner at 5* venue then expect the guests to cover the cost? Uniquely Singapore$$No face lah if u expect to have a FREE wedding with the guests footing the bill for u! üòÇüòÇüòÇ$$You are right ,,, so expensive ,,, tell them buffet downstairs Hdb ,,, better ,,,$$Wow... Please don't invite me to your wedding üò¢$$Please don't invite me if you expect me to cover cost$$wonder go to malaysia ahi char what can u get for RM 500 per pax?$$Bei sai guo in liao.(hokkien). not many can afford such a cost. a couple attend a wedding ang pow come to 500. void deck can also do. cost less. more friends less pressure.wedding is sbout 2 person happiness n blessing from friend n relative. Face saving aside. Bottom line Happy Family n forever loving.$$Ian Khoo may the force be with u$$Foods wastage is very high with 8 Course meals. Should cut down to 5 or less.$$This is ridiculous. Agree that my guests shouldn't be paying for exhorbitant prices.$$Who came up with these numbers anyway?? o.O$$I totally agree to this post!!!!!!$$Ling Madholic Save more please.

message+desc: Island-hopping, anyone? Totaling 124 at low tide and 123 at high tide, the Hundred Islands in Pangasinan is one of the top places to visit if you're coming from Manila. Pristine and undeveloped, it truly is a sight to behold. Best of all, you don't have to break the bank to see it!Alaminos in Pangasi  is riddled with utterly captivating forest green coral islands hugged by cerulean waters, which for the most part, are blissfully deserted. Comprised of 123 sun-kissed islets that houses varied wildlife, the Hundred Islands is the poster boy ‚Ä¶ Continue reading ‚Üí
comments: Been there....would surely love to comeback.....$$Used to go there at least once a month

message+desc:
Where is it?
San Carlos City, Negros Occidental

How to Get There:
Fly from Manila or Cebu to Bacolod.

Or take a bus from Dumaguete to Bacolod.

Or take a boat from Manila to Bacolod.

What is it?
Pintaflores Festival in San Carlos City, Negros features thousands of dancers dressed and painted with colorful flowers.

Fun Fact:
Pintaflores is a combination of two fiestas‚Äîthe Nabingkalan Tattoo Festival and the Dances of the Flowers.

Photo by / Headline by:
Tourism Department of the Philippines / Meggy De Guzman

message+desc:
Japanese hand-made paper, ‚ÄúWASHI‚Äù is shortlisted for UNESCO Intangible Culture Heritage status and will be decided this month, November.

By the way, do you know how to make ‚ÄúWASHI‚Äù? 
It is traditionally made by hand, using the bark of the ‚ÄúGampi‚Äù tree, ‚ÄúMitsumata‚Äù and ‚ÄúKozo‚Äù fiber.
Look at following photos which are showing you some making process, and the yellow flower of ‚ÄúMitsumata‚Äù.
Japanese paper making lessons are available at Gokayama, Toyama Prefecture or Higashi-chichibu, Saitama Prefecture etc., and don‚Äôt you think this will be of one of the great unforgettable memories of Japan to you?
(Gokayama)http://www.tabi-nanto.jp/en/experience/michinoeki_taira_gokayama_washi_no_sato_japanese_paper_making.html
(Higashi-chichibu)http://www.sainokuni-kanko.jp/eng/experience/053.html

Related information;
Echizen Washi, Fukui Prefecture http://www.jnto.go.jp/eng/location/spot/handcrft/echizenwashi.html
Mino Washi, Gifu Prefecture
http://www.jnto.go.jp/eng/location/regional/gifu/mino.html
Ishu Washi, Tottori Prefecture
http://www.jnto.go.jp/eng/location/spot/handcrft/inshuwashi.html
Paper Museum, Tokyo
http://www.jnto.go.jp/eng/location/spot/museum/paper.html

message+desc:
Where is it? 
Lingayen, Pangasinan

What is it?
Want to see a hundred boats parading in Pangasinan's biggest festivity?  Come attend Pista'y Dayat, a two-week thanksgiving celebration that locals hold to express their gratitude for a good harvest from the sea.

Fun Fact:
This is the best time to get to know Pangasinan as Pista'y Dayat also celebrates the province's music, arts and culture! Get ready to witness a few song and dance competitions -- and be ready to join in!

Photo by Tourism Department of the Philippines

message+desc:
Photo of the day is "Rice Paddy Art" in Inakadate Village, Aomori pref. 
When the different colored rice plants grow tall enough, you can see giant artworks like the picture.
It is planted in June and the best time to see the arts is from mid-July to mid-August.
 
You could see beautiful artworks from the observation deck of Inakadae village hall (Open: June 3 - Oct 14, Close: Sept. 29) 
and "Yayoi no Sato" observation deck in "Michi no Eki Inakadate." (Open: June 15 - Oct 14)   
*open from 9am to 5pm (Last entrance: 4:30pm)
 
The arts will change every year, so visit there to find new arts of this year!!

message+desc:
The Hagoita-Ichi (Battledore Fair) is takes place at Sensoji Temple, Asakusa, Tokyo from December 17th to 19th. This is an annual fair held in its precincts at the end of the year. 
These Hagoita (Battledore) are used for good-luck charms for ornamental purposes, they are decorated with gorgeous pictures and accessories. The front of the Hagoita is designed with images of elegantly made-up Kabuki actors, popular celebrities, TV personalities, athletes or anime characters of the year.
Why don‚Äôt you visit and look around this lively fair.

Further Information; 
http://www.jnto.go.jp/eng/location/spot/festival/hagoitaichi.html
http://www.jnto.go.jp/eng/location/regional/tokyo/asakusa.html„ÄÄ
http://www.gotokyo.org/en/kanko/taito/event/hagoita.html

message+desc:
Where is it?
Taal Volcano, Batangas

How to Get There:
Take a bus to Batangas from Cubao or Pasay.

What is it?
One of the smallest active volcanoes in the world, you can reach to the top of Taal Volcano after just a 40-minute hike. Picturesque views, fresh air, and yummy buko juice await you at the peak.

Fun Fact:
One of the smallest active volcanoes in the world, you can reach to the top of Taal Volcano after just a 40-minute hike. Picturesque views, fresh air, and yummy buko juice await you at the peak.

Photo by / Headline by:
George Tapan / Brandon Dollente
comments: Man, your campaign adds really are clever and beautiful; "thank you" to your smart marketing agents, for their simple approach! Love it.$$I heard this place is described as 'an island (Vulcan Pt) within a lake (Crater Lake) on an island (Taal Volcano Island) within a lake (Taal Volcano Lake) on an island (Luzon). Whew!$$Been there twice.  Words will never describe the beauty.$$Come and visit.... just one ride from my place$$We can get there via Tagaytay, that's what the aswang guy is talking about Carla Campos üòÑ$$Been there.... Mostly rode horses to reach the top but we walked all the way whew!!!!! Dunno if i can do that 2nd time around though....$$A lake within a lake...$$Been there.. Wat a view.

message+desc:
Kanda Festival will be held from May 9 to May 15 at Kanda Myojin shrine in Tokyo.This festival is known as one of the three great festivals in Japan.Especially, the parade on May 11th and 12th will be worth seeing! About 300 people march through central Tokyo such as Kanda, Nihonbashi, Otemachi and Marunouchi area on May 11. And, on May 12, about 100 small and large portable shrines gather from each quarter. Hope you like the festival!!
 
More details: http://www.jnto.go.jp/eng/location/spot/festival/kanda.html

message+desc:
Hidden in the Ang Mo Kio heartlands is a small Western kopitiam stall that sells BOTH Salted Egg Fish and Chips and Chilli Crab Fish and Chips! Their killer combo at just $12.90 made our trip worth it.

See more pictures in our review here!
http://eatbook.sg/fish-and-chicks-review/

Update: Fish & Chicks has a new outlet in the basement of Cineleisure!

Never want to miss a post by us again?
Like TheSmartLocal.com FB Page > Click on "Liked" and set Notifications to "All On"
This is part of our undercover review series.

Model: Alicia Teng
comments:
Review zun bo? don't suka suka ask pretty girl go and eat and give good ratings leh....all your reviews for every place you visit like everything oso good :P . 
At least must got certain criteria mah... or else really feel like paid advertisement, den lidat buey zun liao. 

Haha, anyway my take is their wings are good. Unique texture, taste and crunch. but as for their F&C, i'm wondering if they are using Cod fish, (used traditionally for its texture and quality) or sutchi fish(aka catfish)? There's a difference in terms of taste and value for money.

Cat fish usually not the best choice because of origin of breed and also alot of western food stall use them because its super cheap. Most catfish are frozen so its unlikely to be fresh. Go NTUC and see how much one 500g packet cost, and you be surprise at how much you pay for 2 pcs of fish at that price u pay. 

Okok...i abit bo liao, but do a bit more homework before you recommend can... :P$$With this kind of publicity its going to have long queue like the Michelin soya sauce chicken. Don't know worth it or not.$$ÎßàÏù¥ÌÅ¨, remember this place? We went there for a dinner few months back.$$Alan Alexis & Wilson Yeo, let's go tgt & chill with fish & chips! ‚ò∫Ô∏è$$Norman Chan Andy Lau is that the one we went to ?$$Marcus Kwek Yu Rong when i resume my flute lesson!! Can we?!?! Haha$$They have an outlet in Cineleisure. Not nice one.$$Baby, If this week end I recover Mandy Lam$$Che Che G Garduqs alam mo ito? Food trip ulitüòÜ$$Bryan Lau craving for slated egg üòã$$chili crab is the worst of all crab recipes$$Ernest Leong nahh.. This one.. üòã$$Michelle EngYong u know where is this ??$$CindySoh i think this one is better.$$Jeslyn Woon Have you tried this?? Is it really goooood??$$Tried before and not as great.$$Jyks Jlz bring u go eat on Thursday$$Adrian Zee i want eat this.$$Tried the combination of chilli crab n salted egg fish n chip, not worth for $12.90, the fish n sauce is not even anyway so so. The fries n chargrilled chicken is tasteless. Honestly, not worth the trip n price. I think the western food at AMK S-11 beside Jubilee is much better than this.

message+desc:
A Filipina is 2016 Asia's Best Female Chef. Congratulations, Margarita Fores!

LUSSO by Margarita For√©s  Cibo  Alta at Ascott BGCAsia‚Äôs 50 Best Restaurants, sponsored by S.Pellegrino & Acqua Panna, is owned and run by William Reed Business Media, the same organisation behind The World's 50 Best Restaurants and Latin America‚Äôs 50 Best Restaurants. The list is created from the votes of 300-plus industry experts across Asia.
comments:
I would gladly visit her restaurant during my next visit. Overall filipino cuisine, when trying to imitate European or American tastes, has left me greatly disappointed. Plus: While most ordinary filipinos are warm and welcoming, in restaurants they seem to not have a clue about hospitality. This accounts especially for touristy areas, where you will often find lacklustre Italians or even German restaurants (most of them owned by italians or germans who clearly have no passion at all). Filipino cuisine, unlike most pundits will tell you, does not have to hide from other cuisines at all. You can get absolutely delicious dishes, for example in Restaurants in Makati. Simple Lang - Ayala Triangle was the best Restaurant i visited during my last trip. So please do not try to imitate Italians in a sad way, stick to your own cuisine and be proud of it - you surely can!$$My wife and I had the pleasure to taste Gaita's famed cooking when she came to visit Edinburgh and was invited as an honoured guest of Kuya Greg and sister Isabel Fernandez of Lyncliff Hotel. What an unforgettable experience. Congratulations Margarita Fores.$$The Best Chef is who share the best recipes üòÄüçúüçóüç¢$$Congratulations !!!
Great News for The Best Chef . Good Luck & God Bless .$$It's just proves.... The best things come from the Philippines !!!$$At first glance I thought it was JLo...üòÖ$$Philippino I come back tomorrow is my fly from Franfurt too Manila is the 3 Year now 2013, 2014, and this Year 2016 hehehe. From Meik$$Congrats !  Another Pinay to be proud of ! Yeaay...$$AMAZING!! Congratulations to her :)

On March 1st, the Sagano Scenic Railway Torokko Tram began running between Saga Torokko station and Kameoka Torokko station.„ÄÄIt runs for 7.3 km and you can enjoy the scenery of Hozu Valley during the 25-minute ride. If you have been there, please share the experience!
Location information: http://www.jnto.go.jp/eng/location/regional/kyoto/sagano_arashiyama.html

It was just on dusk when we got the train back to Kyoto .

Where is it? 
Masbate, Bicol

What is it like? 
Over 400 cowboys join the Masbate Rodeo every year, and compete for five days. Bull riding, street wrestling, whip cracking and load-carrying are just some of the events in this massive festival.

There are usually 250 heads of cattle and 50 bulls in the rodeo.

Mt. Apo, Mindanao

What is it? 
The sunrise views of Mt. Apo can turn just about any person into a morning person. With an altitude of 2,954 meters, the mountain‚Äôs summit is the highest point in the country.

Fly from Manila to Cotabato, then take a bus to Kidapawan.

Fun Fact: 
Six indigenous tribes still reside in this mountain.

message+desc:
Where is it?
Puerto Princesa, Palawan

How to Get There:
Fly into Puerto Princesa from Busuanga, Cebu, Davao, Iloilo or Manila. 

What is it?
The series of protruding limestone formations unique to Palawan make the province home to lakes as well. These lakes are formed when water is trapped in the spaces in between the limestone cliffs. 

Fun Fact:
A Palawan getaway wouldn‚Äôt be complete without limestone cliff diving. The otherworldly rock formations make a picturesque backdrop for jumpshot-off-the-cliff photos.

Photo by / Headline by:
George Tapan / Jao Bautista
comments: Also try climbing the oldest tree and go mountaineering at the highest peak in the Visayas at the Negros Oriental side(near Cebu city and Bacolod),view more photos @ my page of Canlaon city$$It's Coron Island, not PP....

message+desc:
We are showing our gratitude in New York, London, Paris, Berlin, Toronto, Tokyo, Sydney, Seoul and Singapore! This is  our way of saying Thank You to the world for the love and support they‚Äôve given us since Typhoon Haiyan/Yolanda 3 months ago. If you spot our thank you billboards, share it with us. 

Here's one from Picadilly Circus all the way in London!  #PHthankyou
comments:
thank you world..God bless..$$thank you world

#PHthankyou$$They are saying thank u but where is the Money gone?$$That's the way to go !!! Love the Philippines$$Indeed let all Filipinos be glad as we once again proved the indomita ble spirit and resolve that ppinoys have shown thru the centuries. The ability to smile even when faced with death or stench of death at the worst, hungrr and pain as in last typhoon haiyan/ yolanda. Our faith in God has once again held us together when faced with adversities. I hope that leaders will not only rule with their head but also with their heart and conscience and say " enough is enough" let us work together to bring the Philippines forward in a manner that bests its last best and continue to work and believe the best is yet to come.for the Philippines and all pinoys.$$Yes.Thank you world.We Taclobanons are still waiting for the much needed rehabilitation.3 months have gone by.....$$Thank you and we shall never forget

message+desc:
Where is it? 
Anilao, Batangas

What is it like? 
Located in Southern Luzon, just a few hours from Metro Manila, Anilao is a popular weekend getaway for divers and underwater photographers. A few feet into the water and you can already see the exciting marine life that lies beneath!

How to get there: 
Take a bus to Batangas from Cubao or Pasay.

Fun Fact: 
There are thatched bamboo rafts, rustic cabins and picnic cabanas available for rent at the many local resorts that line the shore.

Photo by/Author: 
Elmer Yu/Wanggo Gallaga

message+desc:
The Sumida Hokusai Museum in Sumida Ward, Tokyo which opened on November 22, 2016, collects and exhibits the many works of world-renowned 19th century Japanese artist Katsushika Hokusai. Hokusai was best known for his ukiyo-e art, woodblock works, and nikuhitsuga paintings. In his birthplace of Sumida Ward, you can also find Tokyo's newest (and tallest) tourist attraction ‚Äì the staggering 634m (2080.5 ft) tall Tokyo Skytree! Experience Japan's past and present side by side at this iconic location!
More Story; http://japan-magazine.jnto.go.jp/en/1612_hokusai.html
comments: William Anthony Betts it's our wall picture

message+desc:
Where is it? 
Intramuros, Manila

What is it like? 
Intramuros was once the seat of Spanish-colonial power. Historical tours and remnants of the country's colorful past can be found here in Old Manila.

How to get there: 
Fly into Manila through one of more than 30 international airlines. You can also fly in from any major Philippine city.

Or take a bus from any major city in Luzon.

Fun Fact: 
Intramuros means "within the walls." Part of the complex is San Agustin Church ‚Äì a UNESCO World Heritage Site.

Photo by/Author: 
George Tapan/Wanggo Gallaga

Hehehehe...$$Many fine memories here...& many more to come.$$Nkarating n aq jn nung highschool aq one of d storycal place ng phillippines$$World harit Sundarbon.Maney people  of our country came from coxses bazar,it is nice & beautiful place..

message+desc:
There are so many Tenman-gu Shrines in Japan. These enshrine Sugawara Michizane, who has been worshipped in Japan since ancient times as the god or patron saint of scholarship. One of very well-known Tenman-gu Shrines takes place in Fukuoka prefecture, Kyushu is Dazaifu Tenman-gu Shrine.
On a daily basis, many believers or tourists who would like to be given intelligence are visiting the shrine for praying. There are some tips when you visit this shrine;
1. Please do not turn your face when you are walking across the bridge.
2. Please touch the body parts of the cow statue, where you want to make yourself better.>e.g. Head = become wise, Eye = recover your eyesight etc.
3. Please taste some plum! The place is famous for the plum!
Is there any more tips you would like to share?
More informationÔºö
http://www.jnto.go.jp/eng/location/spot/shritemp/dazaifutenmangu.html
http://www.jnto.go.jp/eng/location/regional/fukuoka/dazaifu.html
http://www.dazaifutenmangu.or.jp/en

Share with us in the comment box below! ^_^ #ShoppingInKorea #VisitKorea
comments:
Wow i think i could spend a lot of time in supermarkets in korea! Are those supermarkets easy to find in Seoul?$$Kimchi!!! :) how about you? ^^$$Beautyful & Best Food Kimchi!!! :) how about you? ^^#KoreaTourismOrganisation$$Binch! So love it! Good thing there's a Korean store around my work place! ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•$$Waiting for halal supermarket for korean food in korea (since i love korean food very much),  so as a muslim i don't have to worry while i'm in korea for vac or visiting my son. Hopefully there will be soon.. :) ... I like korea.. :)$$My absolute favorite are the seaweed snacks!
Korea also has the best premium yoghurt! Walnut ice-cream, choco-pies, Ramyeon, pears, almonds, sushi, fried chicken, ori gogi, crab, pumpkin tea,  Korean chilli paste, Soy bean paste, green-tea ice-cream, cookies, tofu, aloe juice, mango juice, coffee and the list goes on and on! Korea has some of the best fresh vegetables and fruit, i always shopped at E-Mart in Cheonan and I always spent too much money there and I could spend all day just enjoying looking at everything they offer! Korean supermarkets are sooo AMAZING!!$$homeplus anything 1+1 ahha$$The last trip in Korea I didn't go to any supermarkets but next month I'm going again so Íº≠ most visit these 3$$This I am yet to try. We ran out of time going to scenic spots that we forgot to shop for food and goodies. Here at home I often visit Korean groceries for ramyun, Korean ice cream, soju, makgeoli and chocolates!:)$$whenever I saw a Korea supermarket, I am buying Kimchi and looking for Ramyeon and Korean snacks/drinks that I haven't taste before ^^$$We haven't tried any of the supermarkets in Korea. message+desc:
Would you stay here?

As we cruised along the shoreline of San Vicente, we came across this little hut on the beach. Endless palms stack along each side and blend into the horizons, while the view overlooks the West, giving the opportunity to conclude each day to a private, stunning sundown. An ideal spot to disconnect and unwind, this place is the definition of the much sought after "beach getaway."

Words and Photo by Michael G. Quinn

Can't wait!!$$I'm waiting someone to take me there. üòélol$$This is living life to the fullest.$$I will in summer time, nice place to relax$$https://youtu.be/nL0iaHz3DqM

message+desc:
After spending at least a month in every country, this travel writer ranked the best countries in Southeast Asia for travel. Do you agree with her? Tell us in the comments section below!

https://www.thrillist.com/travel/nation/the-best-countries-in-southeast-asia-to-visit-rankedSomehow we only mention "The Beach" once!
comments:
Ph in the middle is abit low i think.. Except for the food complaint, i am not sure where he got his trouble with atm`s and bus seats... usually works fine for me, foreign credit cards and foreign bodytype :)   Thailand on top? only 1st  they have the right to is the food.. for the rest.. meh..  top notch thai resorts are also the best in SE Asia, but who can slosh out 800 dollar a night for that?  And they really suffer under the one thing they are really proud of.. that they never were a colony.. good for them, of course, but it also means introvertion, no curiosity towards other cultures, No foreign language skills outside main cities&tourist places.  All this is no problem for the thais,, but when considered as a tourist destination.. not so good.. One month in each place is also way too little.. i have racked up 5 months in the Ph.. and my bucket list just getting longer and longer :) As opposed to Thailand, where i was more or less bummed out by most of the things there after less than 3 months in total..$$I don't know why they love Thai foods!! My goodness I tried some of their foods especially the noodle in Bangkok and I would say it really tastes bad. The Philippines' just really not clear for some foreigners because honestly we're very different compared to our asian neighbors. They are composed of temples and other REALLY ASIAN icons and we have that big difference of having western culture and tradition which makes us not so familiar in the word ASIAN as even foreigners thinking if we're really asian or pacific islanders. But not too bad having western culture as it  doesn't makes us different from asia < I guess we're just having a big difference compare for them. #Philippines$$Not really bec she ranked PH midlist, which is not bad, bec of nonfunctional atms and small seated busses. If she had ranked the places base on the amount and quality of attractions, PH should be at least no 2 or 1.  JS$$Ranking is subjective. I just have to react to the suggestion to "improve the cuisine". Our food is part of who we are. Take it or leave it. And yes, we love adobo.$$I think issue with pinoy food is that we have lots of variety and havent figure out yet what we have to showcase to tourist, we have been serving them fiesta foods over and over like lechon,lechon kawali, kare kare, etc.. this are unhealthy and health conscious wouldnt rave about this
Why not develop our food identity by focusing on whats uniquely pinoy, like for soup, tinola, for vegetable laing, for chicken, inasal, for pork,pochero or adobo or even dinuguan, for fish kilawin tanigue,tinolang isda and the list goes on.

We can even introduce them with boodle fights, which gave new yorkers good impression on our food, filipino food has a lot of potential we just havent figure out yet where to start, and what food we have to focus on$$By placing the Philippines on the 6th spot, I don't think this man really experienced what the Philippines is all about...$$Thailand, Indonesia, & Malaysia, all better than Philippines. but not Cambodia! How can anybody pick Cambodia as #1 is beyond me! Cambodia is still struggling with having enough electricity and proper paved roads and high poverty! and the health care is usually no good. at least in Philippines the health care is good and affordable, among other things. definitely Indonesia has everything and more than any other Southeast Asian country, security is professional, food is amazing, health care good & affordable, infrastructure good, and prices cheap, plus many more things! plus the many foreigners & tourists to not make you feel like some kind of orphan.therefore Indonesia #1! :) (y)$$Hmmm I think our government should take this constructively. There are so many challenges foreigners must take to get into their destinations. Tayo nga n Pilipino hirap s biyahe ehh iisipin p natin kung worth it ung pagod s biyahe.üòÜ But I love Philippines! üòä$$Asawa ko british at first he complain about the food but now he luvs the food and he think he just tried the wrong food. Kaya no wonder to this man üòÅ.$$Kind of spot on with the review, where are the veggies?  However, both visits I entered thinking "what am I doing here" but by the end I didn't want to leave.
http://wp.me/p79l93-tX$$I love my country,  the beautiful PHILIPPINES...$$They are all the Same. Rip Off the foreigners.$$Maybe they havent tried this yet$$Been to 4 out of the 11, and lived in the Philippines. #grateful$$Phillipines. A small big  beautiful country. Nothing compares to you.$$Dan Scott Cambodia is #1, but we goin Phils yo!!$$Denis i stopped reading when i got to number 6. unacceptable!$$Sheen "full moon party douchery" haha$$Which country did she rank$$Get 10000 Like, 5000 Friend Request And Many More From ==> WWW. Zelikers .COM <== ^_^

message+desc: 11.11 It's #PeperoDay in #Korea today! For those who are new to this #KoreanCulture, peperos are simply chocolate covered cookie sticks. Have you seen them during your #VisitKorea? Let us know which is YOUR favorite #pepero flavor! :p
comments:
Farmer's day or Pepero's day ...just a day for getting people together and to have fun too...so why worries? I love hazelnut pepero...I will catch u there next month...pepero...am coming$$..i wanna share my experience the day before the pepero day, it was 1:30am last November 10. 

Me and my friend got lost in seoul. We are both Filipinos and it was the first day of our vacation, so expect us to forget our way out of the subway. Haha. Yes, because of excitement we forgot to remember the station and the exit near our guesthouse. We got the last trip to seoul station that night and we walk back and forth to the exits to remember our way out until our feet and legs got very tired. We decided to go out of one station and ask someone for directions but no one can understand english well and also they didnt know where is our address(we also asked someone in the reception of a school and he told us that we are far from our address) We are in doubt of his direction because as far as i remember i actually said to my friend that we are not near yongsan station but seoul station on our first ride on the subway so i am really in doubt of what he said. But because we are hopeless that night we bought tickets to yongsan station just to get home. But our doubt is so big that we decided to go out again of the seoul station and find our way home. While walking on the streets my friend suddenly called someones attention, we asked him if he know our address (we show him our guesthouse reservation) and he responded that we are on seoul and our address is in yongsan that is very far from our current location. He started to find our way through google maps and showed us the distance and it is actually really far. We insisted that our address is near seoul station but we cannot remember where in seoul. He search again and again on google maps and we can feel that he dont believe us until he asked us if we trust him. I said of course we trust him (because he looks trust worthy and we are hopeless that time). So he asked us to follow him (yes, he really guide us to our guesthouse). Near our guesthouse i can feel the happiness (of course because we found our way home and we can now rest). We didnt know how to thank him. I asked him if there is something that we can do to thank him and he just said "no, its pepero day tomorrow. Do you know pepero day?" and i said "yes" and he lend us his box of krispy kreme and said "this is for you, tomorrow is pepero day" (i didnt remember everything that he said but it was like pepero day is a day of helping, sharing and love. At first i did not accept his krispy kreme because i am ashamed of him (he helped us find our way home and now giving us a box of donuts) because it is too much for us but he insisted so we end up accepting it. All we can say that time to him is thank you so much again and again. We are very thankful because he passed through us when we our hopeless. We dont need his donuts, his kindness is too much for us. His name is Tong Kwon. We are very thankful that we met him. :)$$Yes I love PAPERO....Next Autumn I m going to Korea...but my concern is #HALAL food. What I heard hard to find halal food in Korea different in Japan..they are halal freindly...$$A free OctoPepero Box for your Pepero by OctoGang. Click on the link below to download the PDF file. Happy Pepero Day and enjoy~

http://issuu.com/takosdiary/docs/octopepero/1

#PeperoDay #Pepero #OctoGang #OctoGangDiary #Papercraft #Korea$$Havent go to Korea yet but my favourite is hazelnut Pepero! hehe$$My favorite is Strawberry Pepero. Happy #PeperoDay to fellow #VisitKorea fans out there as well as Korea Tourism Organization - VisitKorea staff <3 :*$$When i see pepero, it reminds about handsome boy, haha exo ^^$$Erin it's a whole day devoted to poky sticks! It's HUGE in Korea.$$H Min Park~ gwapo..haha..i want this for christmas..hahaha...joke..$$Melon and strawberry..but cant get it last month when was in korea.üò≠üò≠$$Kimballina Seelua Unni have fun with Peperos today!!!$$Caroline Hannah Luu! PEPERO DAY!!! <3 theres such a thing?!?$$Citra Bramanti Puteri don't forget to buy this when we arrive there. Make it in our bucket lists$$Yes I love PAPERO....Next Autumn I m going to Korea...but my concern is #HALAL food. What I heard hard to find halal food in Korea different in Japan..they are halal freindly...$$Got too much of Pepero .. love 'em$$chocolate with almond!!!$$Happy Peppero Day! My favourite is the almond one!$$Chocolate Almond and Green Tea are my fave <3

message+desc:
Discover new wonders in Kawagoe and Nikko with a discount ticket!
Located only a short distance from Tokyo, there are tourist spots with undiscovered allure. 
In Kawagoe, 30 minutes from central Tokyo, you can enjoy both the historic landscape of the town and exciting festivals.
If you go further north to Nikko, a World Heritage Site two hours from Tokyo, rich and impressive nature awaits. 

More Story: http://japan-magazine.jnto.go.jp/en/special_tobu03.html

message+desc:
Are you ready to celebrate a brand new year?
On New Year‚Äôs Eve in Japan, many people stay at home and wait up until midnight to hear to the ‚ÄúJoya-no-Kane‚Äù, New Year's Eve bells and their 108 chimes. Buddhists believe that there are a total of 108 sins, and that by ringing the bell 108 times, they can be driven away so that we may begin the year with a fresh start. Talk about ringing in the New Year! 
Related Information; http://www.jnto.go.jp/eng/indepth/cultural/experience/e.html
comments: I have many fond memories of taking turns to ring the bell with my fellow villagers whole the priests handed out the hot sake in the snow.  Special.$$This looks like the bell in the park in San Pedro.$$Let's ring in the new year. Akemashite omedetou.

message+desc:
Special year for Japan‚Äôs major shrine ‚ÄúIse Jingu‚Äù
Ise Jingu is one of Shinto's holiest and most important sites and it has a history of more than 2000 years. 2013 is a year of renewal for Ise Jingu. The enshrined object is transferred from the old shrine to the newly built one. It is a big event as it is done once in 20 years. message+desc: Howrah Railway Station is the oldest railway station and the largest railway complex in India. With 23 platforms, it is one of the busiest railway stations in the country in terms of passenger volume per day. The #Howrah railway station also has the distinction of being the railway station with the highest train-handling capacity.
comments: Howrah railway station (HWH) in West Bengal, India is the largest railway station in all of South Asia by area! It daily handles the largest number of trains than any railway station in the Indian subcontinent! Having 23 platforms in all, the highest in South Asia, it possesses one of the most complex and massive route relay interlocking systems. Mail, Express, Passenger, MEMU, DEMU and Kolkata suburban railway commuter trains (EMU trains) throng the railway station very frequently. Passenger density, train density and track density is one if the highest in the country. The railway station is operated both by Eastern Railway (Howrah Division) and South Eastern Railway (Kharagpur Division) of Indian Railways, the 3rd largest passenger railway network in the world! The OHE of the railway station is fully AC electrified.

message+desc:
Where is it? 
Olango Islands, Cebu

What is it? 
This island group is composed of the main Olango Island and its six satellite islets. The site is a wildlife sanctuary that serves as a pit stop for migratory birds that come from as far as China, Japan and Siberia.

How to get there: 
Fly into Cebu from Hongkong, Singapore, Narita, Incheon, or any major Philippine city.

Or take a bus to Cebu from either Dumaguete or Bacolod. Or take your car via a Roll-On Roll-Off (RORO) ferry.

Or take a boat to Cebu from Manila or any major city in Visayas and Mindanao.

Fun Fact: 
The seven islands of the Olango group are joined together by a continuous reef. This makes the site a nice diving spot as well.

Photo by/Headline by: 
Tourism Department Philippines / Jao Bautista

Take a picture of this monument in the Tutuban Mall shopping plaza as part of your entry for the Byaheng Bonifacio: Biyaheng Bayani ng Bayan contest. 

To learn more, visit http://www.gov.ph/bonifacio-150/
Photo from http://www.senorenrique.blogspot.com

The year 2015 is the 400th anniversary of the death of Ieyasu Tokugawa, the first Shogun of the Edo Shogunate. 
This year, many extravagant festivals and events will be held at places including Nikko Toshogu Shrine, where Ieyasu is enshrined.  This is a rare opportunity to visit Nikko, so hop on the limited express train SPACIA in shiny gold, and head out to Nikko!

More Story;
http://japan-magazine.jnto.go.jp/en/special_tobu02.html

message+desc:
Where is it?
Barracuda Lake, Palawan

What is it?
There are many amazing and unusual dive sites in the Philippines and Barracuda Lake is one of them. It starts with a 10-minute hike up a limestone mountain. Then you‚Äôll be able to enjoy a 33-meter dive to a narrow cave. 

Fun Fact:
The Barracuda Lake is named for its resident barracuda. If you‚Äôre lucky, it might become your dive buddy.

Photo by / Headline by:
Jeffrey Bautista  / Brandon Dollente

message+desc: The cuisine of #Goa is a fascinating reflection of its history and heritage. The cuisine is mainly influenced by its Hindu origins, Portuguese colonialism, and some innovative techniques. Fish, coconut milk, rice, and local spices are the major components of Goan cuisine. Goan cuisine is basically characterized by the intense use of spices and flavours and use of kokum.  The most common delicacy is Kingfish (Vison or Viswan), Pomfret, Shark, Tuna and Mackerel, Crabs, Prawns, Tiger Prawns, Lobster, Squid, and Mussels.
comments: Goan cuisine is influenced by various cultures and it is blended in a unique way which can satisfy everyone's tastebuds.

Apart from the usual English classics like Fish & Chips and Steak & Ale Pie, they also serve unique offerings like Toad In The Hole - a traditional British delicacy you can't find elsewhere in Singapore. message+desc:
There's a reason they call it golden hour.

Upon arriving in El Nido, we raced to the town's shore to catch sundown. The tide was slowly rolling in, as boats began to arrive from a day's adventure at sea. Golds began to color the sky, and gleam directly onto the town, full of life. Suddenly these two dogs came sprinting down the beach, and began roughhousing directly in front of us. It wasn't long until they lost steam and plopped on the sand next to us, as we watched the sun drop, bleeding its colors to the final day's pastels on the water's reflection.

Words and Photo by Michael G. Quinn

message+desc:
Mt. Pulag has gotten a bad reputation for being too crowded but the National Park has improved the situation and worked on limiting the number of hikers to between 200-300 per day. In this picture, you can see a few hikers on top of peak 2, with the sea of clouds in the background. The playground of the gods actually felt like an actual playground where we could roam around without bumping onto other mountaineers!

If you do visit, please remember to #LeaveNoTrace! Ensure to use the established paths and avoid creating new ones. Also be respectful of other visitors by avoiding loud noises.

Words and Photo by @tugaff
comments: https://www.facebook.com/events/1084556944956138/?ti=icl lets go to pulag :) saddle point camping

message+desc:
Very pretty cakes + very highly rated. A rare combination that exists in our gimmicky visual-centric Singapore cafe scene!A five-minute walk from Telok Blangah MRT Station, Out Of The Cake Box is a small bakery cafe that transforms traditional desserts into atas cakes. Expect Mao Shan Wang Cake in a plastic bag and Bo Bo Cha Cha Cake served like a $1 ice-cream wafer!

Find out how they taste and check out more pictures from our full-review here:
http://eatbook.sg/out-of-the-cake-box/

message+desc:
Panoramic Autumn view with National treasure

Aichi prefecture has a number of beautiful Autumn foliage spots. You can enjoy even with the Japanese castle in Inuyama City which is located in northwestern Aichi. It is a national treasure with the oldest castle tower in existence in Japan, which still remains the atmosphere of an old castle town built in the 17th century. November is the best month to enjoy both natural and cultural value.

Aichi Pref.
http://www.jnto.go.jp/eng/location/regional/aichi/index.html
http://www.aichi-kanko.jp.e.io.hp.transer.com/

message+desc:
The e-Tourist Visa (e-TV) facility will be extended to 37 more countries from tomorrow. The total count of countries under the scheme will become 150. 

The new 37 countries included in e-Tourist Visa scheme are Albania, Austria, Bosnia & Herzegovina, Botswana, Brunei, Bulgaria, Cape Verde, Comoros, Cote d'lvoire, Croatia, Czech Republic, Denmark, Eritrea, Gabon, Gambia, Ghana, Greece, Guinea, Iceland, Lesotho, Liberia, Madagascar, Malawi, Moldova, Namibia, Romania, San Marino, Senegal, Serbia, Slovakia, South Africa, Swaziland, Switzerland, Tajikistan, Trinidad & Tobago, Zambia and Zimbabwe. 

Government of India had launched the e-TV facility on November 27, 2014. Till now the scheme has been extended to 113 countries at sixteen Indian airports designated for providing e-Tourist visa service.
https://indianvisaonline.gov.in/visa/tvoa.html

message+desc:
Countdowns at midnight are standard in any country, but the traditional Korean way to celebrate the new year is to bask in the glow of the first sunrise, hence the many sunrise festivals around the nation.

We will be counting down the days until New Years with a photo of a sunrise each day until January 1st. First up is Ulsan's Ganjeolgot Sunrise Festival >>> http://bit.ly/V3GRZR

message+desc:
Pithoragarh - Abundant natural beauty and stunning snowy view
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
The easternmost hill district of Uttarakhand, Pithoragarh and its surroundings are known for their abundant natural beauty. Nestling in a small valley, barely 5 km long and 2 km wide, the town was an important landmark during the reign of the Chand Rajas of Kumaon. 

Pithoragarh is the district headquarters and its government buildings are housed in the hill fort of Pithoragarh at a distance of 7 km from the main town. From the Chandak hill located here, one gets a panoramic view of snowy ranges extending from the Trishul-Nanda Devi, Panchchuli Group to Mount Appi of Nepal. 

- See more at: http://incredibleindia.org/index.php/travel/destination/pithoragarh

And where is the death penalty for the killing of little girls under the age of five? Where is the death penalty for the dowry deaths? Why do you unfairly still equate boys with money?  The world is learning of these atrocities. You are committing a holocaust against women and girls. Need I remind you that without women - none of us would be here?

message+desc:
Watch out‚Äîshark passing through! Divers who have the wonderful opportunity to swim in Monad Shoal in Malapascua Island, Cebu will be delighted with views like this one. 

Photo by Noel Guevara
comments:
Thanks for featuring my photo! This shot was taken at Monad Shoal, Malapascua, Cebu. Thresher Sharks are very shy and scared of divers, which makes this a very special moment. 

This photo is not photoshopped. It just seems that way because it was taken at 5am in the morning at 135 feet-- so it was very dark. :) My camera's ISO was set to 2000, hence the grain. Here's another shot as it swam closer to the divers. It was very surreal! :)$$Thresher Sharks are harmless, but I did get my camera whipped out of my hand after a friend cought one in New Zealand once.$$I would not be diving$$Just two days ago ,I watched this shark on NATGEO featuring diff. Kinds of sharks & it was shot in the sea / channel between Negros & Cebu . This kind of shark is found only in the Phil. And they call it Ninja sharks .  .  .sana TULISAN SHARK. EH PINOY NAMAN ANG HAYUP .DIBA?!$$No thanks.  I may be a vegetarian, but I still like being at the top of the food chain.$$That shark might be tasty for sushi and bar-b-que$$Thank you...learned something. There are shy shark too.$$That picture seems taken in malapasqua !!$$Such stupid visiting forces and civilians alike that ruin our National treasures should be subjected to very high fines and life imprisonment*!!$$Saving money now for this...hihi$$TRESHER!! that is what you are!~ XD
