message+desc:
The #Philippines has just successfully finished hosting the ASEAN Tourism Forum 2016, the annual gathering of all the Tourism Ministers in the ASEAN Region plus China, Japan, Korea, and India.

We hope all our friends from the ASEAN region and Asia had a wonderful time of their lives! Congratulations to all our colleagues from the Department of Tourism @tourismphl, the Tourism Promotions Board, the Tourism Congress of the Philippines, and all the stakeholders from the Philippine tourism industry for being gracious, wonderful hosts.

To our friends from YourSingapore who will host next year's ASEAN Tourism Forum, sending your our best regards!

Photo courtesy: @toddumpa on Instagram, in Calaguas Islands, Camarines Norte

message+desc:
Kepulauan Togean di Sulawesi Tengah menjadi salah satu basis para suku Bajo yang tinggal di lautan. Terletak di Teluk Tomini, Sulawesi Tengah, secara administratif wilayah ini berada di Kabupaten Tojo Una-Una dan dikenal kaya akan terumbu karang dan berbagai biota laut yang langka dan dilindungi. Dibentuk oleh aktivitas vulkanis, pulau ini ditutupi oleh tumbuh-tumbuhan yang subur dan rimbun sekaligus dikelilingi oleh formasi bukit karang, tempat bagi beberapa binatang laut seperti kura-kura hijau untuk tinggal dan berkembang biak. bit.ly/1mZOceI

#WonderfulIndonesia #PesonaIndonesia
comments: Very good information about the Togean islands at the new German Travel book Sulawesi On The Road and Inside Indonesia: http://www.mountainviewtomohon.com/news

I know you have arrived;
my heart skips a beat when
you walk up to my side.

I hope this kind of magic stays
forever between us two,
and the whole wide world will
know that God sent me you.$$If I could reach up and hold a star for every time you've made me smile,
the entire evening sky would be in the palm of my hand.... <3$$My love for you is as big as I love Korea. And I love Korea so much.^^$$I've been dreaming of a true love's kiss... Hoping it to be you... ‚ù§

message+desc:
Seasonal flower viewing in Japan makes for quite a sight!.
There are many places where your eyes can dine on the visual feast of flowers in bloom. Rhododendron (Middle of April to the beginning of May), Wisteria (Middle of April to the middle of May), Nemophila (Late April to the middle of May) and Red spider lily (Middle of September) flowers can all be seen at many iconic locations around the country.
Come and see Japan in the year ahead! We are eagerly await your visit!
Related Information; http://www.jnto.go.jp/eng/attractions/rest/hana/hana_p4.html

message+desc:
The biggest storm may have hit us, but now, things are looking up! Even the United Nations World Tourism Organization (UNWTO) seems to think so: ‚ÄúUNWTO is confident that despite this tragic occurrence, the tourism sector in the Philippines will continue to strive and make a key contribution to the development of the country,‚Äù said UNWTO secretary-general Taleb Rifai. 

Bangon Pilipinas!International travel organizations have expressed readiness to support the Philippines in any tourism-related recovery program for areas ravaged by the recent calamity.
comments: The Philippines must and should use Sustainable Development strategies when redeveloping with the people and environment put first before industry and profits$$Does DOT have a disaster zone tourism program? As a temporary livelihood since rehabilitation will take a long time, I'm sure many typhoon survivors may qualify as guides to the devastated areas. Disasters like Yolanda and its international publicity are rare. The gov't can promote the devastated areas as temporary tourist spots.

message+desc:
Where is it? 
Danao Park, Bohol

What is it like?
The Danao Adventure Park offers eco-adventure tourism lovers another face of Bohol. Some of the many varied activities include kayaking, river trekking, rappelling, rock climbing, and visits to cultural heritage sites.

How to get there: 
Fly from Manila to Tagbilaran.

Or take the Roll-On Roll-Off (RORO) ferry from Cebu to Tagbilaran.

Or take a boat from Cebu or any of the major cities in Mindanao to Tagbilaran.

Then take a bus or van to Danao.

Fun Fact: 
The zipline in Danao is the Philippines's longest and tallest, running half a kilometer from one mountain to another. Only for the most hardcore adventurers, the zipline has been dubbed the "sui-slide." It's certainly not for the faint of heart.

Photo by/Headline by: 
Tourism Department Philippines/Rey Tiempo
comments: Beeh here. Tried zipline and bungee jump :)$$Yes.. The best ang the plunge kesa sa dahilayan challenge

message+desc:
One of the oldest ethnic groups in the PH continues to live off our rich seas. Check out these superb images of their day to day lives by clicking on the link below. Don‚Äôt forget to share with your friends!


http://www.dailymail.co.uk/travel/travel_news/article-3218366/Life-sea-tribe-Fascinating-pictures-Filipino-islanders-blend-ancient-tradition-modern-world.htmlPhotographer Jacob Maentz spent two weeks with the Calamian Tagbanua sea tribe, capturing the beauty of their customs and shedding light on some of the issues facing them.
comments:
I'm sorry if anyone would be offended by this. This is just my personal opinion, and I'm open for enlightenment. I might be missing something.

For me, keeping themselves like that makes them more vulnerable to deceit and maltreatment, which is then consequently detrimental over the areas (natural resources, ancestral land, culture) within their right and responsibility. Making themselves distant over the idea of progress and us encouraging them to keep it that way is a contributing factor over many issues concerning discrimination, land grabbing, over-industrialization, and even environmental harms. My proposal is to instead of encouraging them to keep a tribal nature, let's (the government and the people) make way for them to be part of an educated progress and development so that corporate greed would not swallow them whole. Think about it. I mean, sure, it all sounds well and good but ... what is the significance of ethnic tribes in our modern society? They're not animals, people. They're human beings. We shouldn't encourage them to keep it that way just because they "look nice". It's like keeping them in a psychological zoo by telling them it's okay to keep tribal traditions above modern beneficial progress. My point is that we should aim to educate them so that they would be more well-equipped to protect their culture and environment.$$The tribe collect sea cucumbers (pictured) and dry them to be sold on the foreign market, which Maentz found would sell for the equivalent of $83 a kilo.
Maunlad na sna zla kung hnd lng sna kurakot at mapanlinlang ung mga negosyante pinagbebentahan nla..

I support and amaze in this article!$$Beautiful island and the native people as well$$I love Philippines History, some where forgotten.$$i saw about this tribe in tv fox life...$$Beautiful and interesting!$$I hope our government will protect them by keeping them the way they are!
Don't destroy their habitat!$$The local gov`t should help them by having acccess to basic education and social services to improve their way of life for the better and at the same time need to preserved their culture...$$The Tagbanua can be reached through other indigenous tribes like the Mamanwa and the Manubo whom we have in our islands .......$$I love these pictures. Thanks for sharing$$Swee Chen Lim like this page. You'll find out so many interesting things and find too many places to see$$I love my country and my countrymen, no matter what!$$Sea cucumber is so expensive here in HK, omg rich na sana cla.

message+desc:
Vietnam pho for $7.90, yes please.This place is so legit you'll feel like you've been transported to the streets of Hanoi.

Situated in town, this Vietnamese eatery is run by Vietnamese who have not watered down the taste of their food. Open from 11am to 10pm daily, Mrs. Pho serves their Vietnamese dishes at extremely affordable price. 

One main dish, two sides and two drinks only cost us $20! Located in the middle of Golden Mile Complex and Haji Lane, you won't have to worry about getting lost finding this place. 

Another undercover review by Eatbook.sg
http://eatbook.sg/mrs-pho-review/

message+desc:
You may have heard of Play Nation. But we doubt you know about the challenges the founders had to overcome to bring Playnation to life. 

From giving up high paying jobs in financial institutions to earning only $500 a month, the founders have come a long way to make Playnation into the success that it is today. Playnation now serves over 100,000 people and conducts 200 events each year. They will even be opening a third outlet at Tampines by year end! 
To celebrate SMEs which make up a surprising 99 per cent of businesses in Singapore, DBS has partnered us to put together a special series of videos as part of the 99% SME campaign launched by DBS and Singtel to support SMEs.

The campaign culminates with SME Week from 14 - 23rd Oct ‚Äì Playnation is offering a special promotion where you can get one FREE gaming package for every three packages purchased during SME Week! More details on their deal here: https://www.99sme.sg/deal-detail/?id=481

Head over to www.99sme.sg/special-deals to find out more. #SupportOurSMEs

message+desc:
Catch the light and sound spectacle on iconic Hong Kong buildings live on YouTubehttps://www.youtube.com/watch?v=qkGNqLiyTEk (Live Stream Link)

No matter where you are in the world, you can witness the spectacular Hong Kong Pulse 3D Light Show broadcast LIVE on 16 December, featuring festive images to celebrate the joyful holidays.

The 3D light show will light up the iconic buildings of Hong Kong Cultural Centre and Clock Tower at Tsim Sha Tsui.

There will be four performances at 8:20pm, 8:45pm, 9:15pm and 9:45pm, each lasting about eight minutes.

Find more details on the Hong Kong Pulse 3D Light Show here: http://www.discoverhongkong.com/eng/see-do/highlight-attractions/harbour-view/hk-pulse.jsp

message+desc:
Azalea is in full bloom in Sasebo city
In Nagushiyama park (Sasebo city, Nagasaki prefecture) you can see thousands of azalea flowers, hundreds of big and small islands and the blue ocean at the same time. There are also a camp field and people enjoy nature from spring to autumn.

Sasebo city
https://www.jnto.go.jp/eng/location/regional/nagasaki/sasebo.html

message+desc:
#DidYouKnow.. there is an underlying significance to the colors seen on the #NSeoulTower at night. The colors represent the present quality of air in #Seoul! 
- Red: Air quality is really bad :(
- Blue: Air quality is good :D
- Green: Air quality is normal :) 
**Purple, Yellow and White lights are no longer seen at the moment.

message+desc:
A 24-hour VendCafe has opened at a humble Sengkang void deck. You can now purchase hot meals like Claypot Chicken from a vending machine.

There are also snacks and beverages, including Cafe Macchiato and Organic Soy. The food here isn't spectacular, but it's open 24 hours and gives you a glimpse into the future. 
Everything here is $5 or less - perfect for impromptu supper sessions on a budget.

See more pics, address and read our full review here: http://thesmartlocal.com/read/vending-machine-cafe

Overall Verdict: 5/10

The best time to visit Solang Valley is between December and February.

The Monument of Peace and Unity is a proud reminder of the heoric efforts of the Filipinos who bravely fought and participated in the Philippine revolution in the 1800s.

Where is it:
San Pedro, Davao City

Tourists always commend how the doves, a symbol of peace, appear to be flying without any support or strings attached!

Have you ever wanted to become a ninja? Ninjas are stealthy figures, shrouded in mystery. In Iga City, Mie Prefecture, a town historically famous for having produced many ninjas, you can experience the training and lifestyle of the ‚ÄúIga-ryu‚Äù style ninjas.

message+desc: Happy Eid al-Adha for those who celebrate this holy day. On this day, Muslim Indonesians will gather with their friends and families and feast on delicious food. Where is it? 
Boracay Island, Aklan

How to Get There:
Fly from Manila to Caticlan.

Or fly from Manila to Kalibo, then take a bus to Caticlan.

Or take a boat from Manila to Caticlan.

What is it?
An evening at Boracay wouldn‚Äôt be complete without the sight of dancers swinging chains with fire balls on their tips. Ready those cameras to catch the blazing action, but don‚Äôt come too near!

Fun Fact:
There are tons of entertainment options here that suit different tastes. Go to Station 3 for bars that have a reggae vibe, or Station 2 for more vibrant live music. 

Photo by / Headline by:
Tin Sanchez / Donna Dimayuga

message+desc:
Where is it?
Bangui, Ilocos 

How to Get There:
Fly from Taiwan or Manila to Laoag.

Or take a bus from Cubao or Pasay to Laoag.

What is it?
Just outside the municipality of Pagudpud, along the coast of Bangui bay, you‚Äôll see a row of huge windmills measuring 23-storeys high. These giant electric fans help provide up to 40% of electricity to Ilocos Norte. 

Fun Fact:
To see another towering spectacle, you can make a quick drive to Burgos, Ilocos Norte to see the Cape Bojeador Lighthouse. 

Photo by / Headline by:
Grace Consolacion / Brandon Dollente

message+desc:
Coonoor is the second largest hill station in the Nilgiris. It stands on a lower ridge of the plateau at an altitude of 1,858 m (6,100 ft), surrounded by verdant tea and coffee estates. 

This picturesque hill retreat is covered by grassy meadows, with a profusion of sunflowers, marigolds and rhododendrons, all growing wild. 

Coonoor‚Äôs weather remains pleasantly cool throughout the year and this together with its serene surrounding, makes it an ideal place for a peaceful break.

 - See more at: http://www.incredibleindia.org/en/travel/destination/coonoor
comments:
Someone need to ask few simple question from our Honorable Tourism Minister Dr. Mahesh Sharma. 

Where the hell was their PRS on 1st, 2nd and 3rd June from 10:00 AM to 10:05 AM? 
 .
 .
 As if the PRS was not working, then how the tickets could be regretted during that period? 
 .
 . 
 Who should answer ?... Indian Railway, IRCTC or the airlines company.. 
 .
 .
 Prestige's.. I m regularly bomb shelled by checking the PRS system from 10:00 AM to 12:00 AM. The review of activity is like this
 [
 10:00 AM-10:05 AM The PRS system is failed in all India. Still the tickets sold during that period.. this is illogical and bit to surprise.

10:05 AM-10:25 AM a common IRCTC user mainly face a problem related to the payment gateway. 

10:25 AM-12:00 PM Everything becomes normal, if u call the customer care executive.. they will ask for the problem screenshots. And that is resolved in 2 months

I checked the airlines after. The ticket is became costlier than 15,000/-, so, I think its better to fly London or Singapore instead of flying to Ranchi from New Delhi. The prize is even same.

]

I salute my India. The #Incredible_India.

message+desc:
Chinese New Year ‚Ä¶ in Red! 
In Chinese culture, red represents happiness. And in Hong Kong, Chinese New Year is the happiest holiday of the year. Get in the holiday mood with these red-themed festival images. Today‚Äôs topic is ‚Äòeating‚Äô. http://bit.ly/URfAMJ
Chinese New Year ‚Ä¶ in Red! 

Eating: Food is a big part of every Chinese festival and Chinese New Year is no exception. Many foods are considered auspicious such as steamed sticky cake, which sounds like ‚Äòhigher year‚Äô in Chinese. Eating it symbolises rising higher every year. These days, this it comes in many shapes and sizes. http://bit.ly/X6wzv5

90s kids, time to get excited because their founders are back in the restaurant scene with Wicked Kitchen - an East meets West fusion restaurant that offers many one of a kind dishes. message+desc:
Bukhansan Dulle-gil is the trail that goes around Bukhansan National Park.  The courses are mostly paved and the trails are well-marked, making it perfect for novice hikers or families with kids. If you happen to find the dullegil trail too easy, you can easily venture outside of the trail to traverse the intermediate or advanced trails.
 
Each section has a separate entrance and exit, allowing you to choose where to begin. There‚Äôs a description of each of the 21 courses here: http://ecotour.knps.or.kr/dulegil/index_e.asp 

Or download the app by searching for ‚ÄúBukhansan Dulle-gil‚Äù in the app store.

[ Photos by www.flickr.com/traveloriented ]
comments: There must b more beautiful with snow this winter. Can't wait! ><

message+desc:
Deer-horn Cutting Ceremony(12nd-14th Oct)
Nara Park is located in the center of Nara city and inside the park area are Todai-ji Temple, Kasuga-taisha Shrine and many other historic structures that represent the glory of the city over many centuries. There, lots of deer are walking around and living freely. The horn cutting is a traditional ceremony (started in early Edo period) and held to prevent people from being injured. Why don‚Äôt you visit Nara and enjoy historic atmosphere with deer?
Nara Pref.

http://www.jnto.go.jp/eng/location/regional/nara/index.html

http://www.pref.nara.jp/dd.aspx?itemid=79931#itemi
comments: just gonna take a little off the top. dont worry its gonna look great$$I was there three weeks ago, beautiful!!

Good Morning Peeps,

We are certain you have visited Malacca.(spelt as 'Melaka' in the Malay language) 
Do share with us on what attracts you and what would you recommend to fellow FBians who plans to visit there.

 Share with us and we may just have a surprise for you...  ;-)

#malaccacity #alorgajah #jasin #vmy2014 #tmsingapore

posted: fe
comments:
Early morning walk by the canals are Best when the water is calm and you see perfect reflections of the houses.$$Food, Glorious Food.. Warm hearts of Melaka people, historical sites, shopping.Hoping to return to Melaka again with a bunch of friends with kids.$$All of the above :)
@ Padang Temu. .. always stay there. Kampong house. Fab neighbours.$$Cendol Melaka is the best (jam merah )$$Cendol melaka,...love the busy jonker street,the portuguese settlement food is an ummph!,..the pineapple tarts...yummy...you are never bored revisiting melaka time and again..$$A few things to lookout for in Melaka, Bandar Bersejarah... 1) A'famosa Resort and it's themed towns, many children and family activities. 2) Seafood at Muara Sg Duyung, just superb, cheap and spoilt for choice. 3) Dataran Pahlawan area is great for shopping and walking distance to the cultural heritage area too. 4) Coconut shake, great thirst quencher, sinful yet worth it!

message+desc:
For all the clueless girlfriends out there, this is what your ah boy is going through in camp.Life in NS is more than just what you may see in Ah Boys To Men or passing out parade photos.

Some recruits tell what pressures they really experience, from body image issues to pressure to fit in.

https://mustsharenews.com/national-service-stories/
comments: For me I just think that is a phase in life. Go through motion, what matters is at the end of the day lights out leave yesterday's problems behind. Don't think too much. If things are not within your control forget it, don't worry about it. Do not care what people think. So long what decisions you make is reasonable and your decisions does not affect your conscious, you have nothing to worry about.$$Racism can rear its ugly head too. My name meant that it was a constant signal for the sergeants to pick on me since my name was considered 'unique' to them. After all, Eurasians think they're entitled and better than others according to them$$#whatareyouexpecting #whysosurprised$$Marsiling field camp recruit time 1984.....sargeant puts red ants on my buddies dick..... ( dam the good old days)

message+desc:
GOOD NEWS! Starting June 30, the KTX from BUSAN to INCHEON AIRPORT will operate 10 times a day (no need to transfer at Seoul Station). Original news article in Korean: http://bit.ly/SOZbur[Busan News] We have Gimhae Airport, and moreover Incheon Airport is becoming closer to Busan!

From June 30, Korea Train eXpress(KTX) from Busan to Incheon Airport will operates 10 times a day. This is because of the Asian Game scheduled this year and Winter Sport Games in 2018.  It will take less than 3 and half hours by direct train from Busan to the airport! We‚Äôre happy that you guys have one more way to reach easily to Busan, Korea :)

+ It‚Äôs due to the extension of KTX route from Seoul Station to Incheon Airport, so there‚Äôs no need to transfer at Seoul Station. You can check the exact train timetable and cost, and make a reservation from JUNE 17 via Korail ( http://goo.gl/F39bwJ , 1544-7788)
++ Check this article for more details: http://goo.gl/O3yRHs
comments: I'm going to Busan this coming summer vacation! :)$$Good  service  . Will b going  Busan  during  Christmas  holiday  . Hehe  :D$$Is this service operated periodically or permanently?$$This is really a good news!!$$Does that mean I can get to Incheon airport from Daegu as well?! :) that would be great!

message+desc:
Take a walk.

Meet Sevilla's bamboo hanging bridge. The deck is woven of bamboo slabs and although it can be a bit unnerving at first, as it sways and stretches, the support has been redone with cable to ensure safety. Reaching 40 meters in length, this stroll offers incredible perspective of the emerald river beneath. Having arrived here in the early morning hours on my lonesome, it was a perfect time to take in the sights and sounds of the forest before the day's hustle and bustle.

Words and Photo by Michael G. Quinn

message+desc: Sarikayo is one of the well-known desserts in West Sumatera. One of its ingredients is duck eggs, which then mixed with sugar and stirred up to smooth. Once the dough ready, the next step is steamed it in moulds. Sarikayo has varied flavor which represented by the appearance of its color; green refers to pandan taste. #IndonesiaCulinary #WonderfulIndonesia

message+desc:
Where is it? 
Puerto Princesa, Palawan

What is it like? 
Puerto Princesa has world-class attractions for all types of adventurers, from the fearful to the fierce ‚Äì the longest navigable underground river on the planet (Puerto Princesa Subterranean River), one of the world's best dive sites (Tubbataha Reef), a quiet white-sand beach facing South China Sea (Sabang Beach), a bay ideal for snorkeling (Honda Bay) and even several museums for history enthusiasts. 

Fun Fact: 
You can try dolphin-watching at Puerto Princesa Bay and see if you can spot long-snouted spinner dolphins at play. The best time to go is when the seas are calm.

Photo by/Author: 
Tourism Department Philippines/Tin Sanchez

Martin Garlic.. try to visit this place$$Naka visit na kami sa Palawan last year w/ my officemates.. Yes!!! the Place is very amazing..$$Starting Feb 2015, Blue Beach Clubs Palawan will open its doors to guests...we are now accepting reservations for Feb onwards...please pm me for more details...$$I am writing about tourist spots in the Philippines. You might want to visit my blog and hit like and share this one. Thanks. :)
#travel #Philippines #tourism #attractions
‚ñ∫http://phptourism.blogspot.com/2014/10/puerto-princesa-subterranean-river.html$$I <3 Palawan. Been there last summer! Super fun!!! :-D$$Where can you find the deepest trench in the world which produces the largest deposits of deuterium ? The Philippines.$$Yes. Puerto Princesa is amazing! know more here!

message+desc:
Gulmarg - The Meadow Of Flowers
---------------------------------------------------------------------------
Welcome to Gulmarg the hill resort with magical meadows and mountains. Then natural beauty of Gulmarg has attracted tourists since long. In fact the hill resort of Gulmarg literally means "the meadow of flowers". The snow-clad peaks and the lovely landscapes of Gulmarg have provided background for several Bollywood ventures.

The slopes of Gulmarg make it Asia‚Äôs only heli-skiing resort. There are immense beauty and adventure activities that make Gulmarg much more than a cool hill resort. British discovered the hill resort of Gulmarg in 1927 during their colonial rule in India. 
- See more at: http://incredibleindia.org/index.php/travel/destination/gulmarg
comments: Will visit Heaven on the Earth one for sure...

"Engimono" (Lucky charms) have been passed down for generations in many areas of Japan.

message+desc: There's one I don't know the answer to.  Give me  your theories!  I found this statue at a buddhist temple in Gyeongju, the former capital of the Silla Dynasty.  Why do you think they made a statue of a dog?
comments:
That is a good theory!  Do you have a dog statue in your backyard Tina?  hehe  I should have one... my dear puppy passed away last year.  

Marie$$aww I'm sorry to hear that....don't have a backyard yet but I really couldn't tell you why they have a statue of a dog....might be significant in some way but dogs are always loyal creatures..$$Thanks George!  Very useful information.  What do you do?$$I was going to say that the native dog of Korea, the Sapsalgae, is a dog found in the south-eastern part of the Korean Peninsula. It has been designated a natural monument in Gyeongsan which is the neighbouring county of Gyeongju. . These dogs have been bred exclusively as house dogs; their 'work' spiritual rather than physical. Traditionally, these dogs were believed to dispel ghosts and evil spirits and even misfortune
But then the dogs in the picture don‚Äôt look anything like the Sapsalgae nor the Chinese spitz. Just a wild guess.
$$Can you tell me the name of the temple? My hometown is 20 min away from Gyeongju and I went there like once a week, but I never see that... $$By the way, we don't eat dogs. Perhaps a small amount of people might consider it as a delicacy.. it's sickening.. but don't tar everyone with the same brush.. And the British have pigs blood (Black puddings). 

A good intro:
The Korean Jindo Dog (Hangul: ÏßÑÎèóÍ∞ú; Hanja: ÁèçÂ≥∂Í∞ú) is a breed of a hunting dog  known to have originated on Jindo Island  in Korea. Although relatively unknown outside Korea, it is celebrated in its native land for its fierce loyalty and brave nature.$$The name of the temple is Í≥®Íµ¥ÏÇ¨ (Golgulsa), and this statue is located along the path before you reach the temple.$$Some good guesses here- I think to protect the temple is probably the best bet. but, just to add another theory: Could it be to remember the breeds that were made extinct during Japanese occupation?
Although Michael's comment was kind of rude, Kerry, I don't think you can say 'only a small amount' of Koreans eat dog meat- There are 4 
Î≥¥Ïã†ÌÉï restaurants in my neighborhood, and a number of my coworkers, students, and friends have tried or eat it once or twice a year...$$I agree, I think that Michael's comment is very rude. I also don't think that you can even generalize a "small amount" of anything. Some people eat dog but some Hispanics eat Guinea Pigs and some Mormons are polygamous... I personally don't feel that the comment made about dogs being delicious should be included without explanation- I feel like it's Mr. Doyle just trying to be funny and failing. 

But I think that the dog is super cute and that maybe it is a symbol of Chinese influence on Korea. Maybe it was constructed in the year of the dog?$$Perhaps A tribute the dish Kagogi (Kay-go-ghee). I was invited to a traditional wedding of one of the Korean Army compound commanders daughter while stationed there they had Kagogi.
 The South Korean dog meat industry reportedly involves about 1 million dogs, 6,000 restaurants, and 10 percent of the population.  In South Korea there is currently several laws in place that while the laws don't exactly make the sale of dog meat illegal they do make the method of euthanizing canines a lot more palatable and humane.
The chickens I saw in market were live. You chose the bird you wanted, they shoved a ice pick in the hart and put in a feather plucking machine and you took it home and cleaned it at home.
I did not ask the process of getting the meat for the Kagogi. Whether they carried it home in a bag or on a leash but I do know they usually only use dogs bread and raised for that purpose.
Now there is a vast difference in the way things are done in the country and big city's and the way they think and do things.
Yes they do eat Dog meat.$$it's a story of a dog, Haciko$$Ronald I think that is true in most countries that they do things differently in the city than they do in the country. No matter what level of "civilization" we reside in the country folk still tend to be old school on the techniques for most things.$$Hachiko is in Japan so Im wondering about this one in Korea..hmmmmmm...

message+desc:
Marunouchi Illumination 2013
Illuminations lighting up are characteristic of the winter season. But Illumination event are already started at Marunouchi, Tokyo! About one million and ten thousand LED balls in "Champagne Gold", an elegant color peculiar to Marunouchi, will sparkle from the trees along Marunouchi's Naka-dori Street, which links Otemachi with Yuurakucho in central Tokyo. The lighting up can be seen until Feb. 16, 2014
Area guide:
http://www.jnto.go.jp/eng/location/regional/tokyo/tokyochuusinbu.html

message+desc:
We found a Vietnamese BBQ in Singapore!Thai and Korean BBQ are going to seem so passe once you've tried VIETNAMESE BBQ at Lang Nuong. With a metal grill on top of an old-school claypot filled with charcoal right at your table, the BBQ experience here is as real as it gets. At $39.90 for 2, you get a whole lotta seafood, meats and veggies to boot! If your tummy still wants more, there are other Vietnamese dishes you can order here as well.

Find out if the food tastes as good as it looks in our full review:
http://eatbook.sg/lang-nuong/

Like Eatbook.sg for more food videos like this!

Director: Don Lim | Model: Xenia Tan

message+desc:
Kausani - Peace among thickly forested lanes and Himalayan views
------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Located 53 km. to the north of Almora, Kausani, the brithplace of Hindi poet Sumitra Nandan Pant, is a picturesque hill station famous for its scenic splendour and its spectacular view of the Himalayas. Situated at 6075 feet above sea level, atop a narrow ridge, Kausani is thickly forested and separated from the soaring Nanda Devi ranges by low mountains. In 1929, Mahatma Gandhi stayed here at the Anasakti Ashram. 
- See more at: http://incredibleindia.org/index.php/travel/destination/kausani
comments:
Too bad I can't visit India. I have a confirmed flight to India, but won't be using it after failing to get a tourist visa here in KL. The corruption encountered at the visa office was more than I would accept. I won't play along with this. In detail:

- I was pressured to buy premium service (whatever that is)
- I was forced to give wrong information on the form, concerning my permanent address.
- I was forced to buy overpriced photographs, as they wouldn't accept my own photographs.

Until your country fixes this, I simply won't be able to visit. Already cancelled my hotel.$$and than there is the other side....http://www.sify.com/news/sexual-harassment-when-cops-turn-criminals-news-columns-ogqjW8hfdggij.html

Where is it?
Boracay, Aklan

What is it?
If you're the type who loves massages, try having one by the famous beach of Boracay. You can rest on a lounge chair while a masseuse melts your stresses away. You can even do it at night beneath a view of the star-lit sky.

Fun Fact:
There are many spas in Boracay. You can go to a luxury spa or have a masseuse go to your hotel room for less than $8.

Photo by / Headline by:

message+desc:
Don't you love this version of our MRT map? It's a lot more accurate too! :) Credit: Bernie Ng

Follow TheSmartLocal.com and never miss our biggest stories and shares again!

"I saw your recent post regarding future Singapore MRT/LRT maps and thought I‚Äôd throw mine into the ring. The Singapore MRT has long been one of my fave metro systems around the world. 

I like the concept of destination numbers and station numbers - I believe it is one of the first, if not the first, to use this concept (do let me know if that‚Äôs not quite right).  

My approach for this map is to incorporate the station number into the station marker itself to avoid some of the clutter associated placing the station name AND the number alongside the station marker.  

Also, I really wanted the Circle Line to be a circle, so I have adopted a few distortions to make that happen. Finally, I tried to incorporate geography of Singapore in a stylistic manner to further reinforce the circle motif. 

More info: http://transitmaps.tumblr.com/post/68121163229/singapore-bernie-ng
comments: This version looks better, nicer and more clearer view$$I prefer this version over the other one$$Based on this visual, it's about time more attn should be given to our northern hemisphere, I.e. Deft$$Distance between Khatib and Yio chu kang is much longer than that

Meanwhile, Jangho's southern neighbour, Galnam Port, is a hidden gem with a daily fog show.

Photos by Leigh MacArthur Photography
comments: Great photos.  You capture the heart of Korea!  Thanks for sharing.$$Hello! Have you ever been on Mars (Industrial tourism)? https://www.facebook.com/groups/480112758743622/ If you haven't so Mars and its landscapes are waiting for you in Kryvyi Rih, Ukraine. Kryvyi Rih is a city where human labor in alliance with nature has created unique landscapes and man-made lakes which is unique anywhere in the world. Welcome to the universal city where you will also find traces of life of the Aryan tribes, Scythian burial mounds, centuries-old oak trees, fantastically shaped rocks near the river banks, mountain stream in the desert, the Martian soil, waterfalls, caves and much more. I organize free excursions! Here is my group https://www.facebook.com/groups/480112758743622/$$korea a land touched and loved by summer$$Great use of lighting in these photos!

message+desc:
Where is it? 
Siargao, Surigao del Norte

What is it like? 
The Philippines isn‚Äôt a major surf destination yet. That means more waves for you. We recommend hitting the beaches of Siargao, the country's surfing capital. Its popular surfing points have interesting names: Jack Horse, Quiksilver and the famous Cloud 9 ‚Äî known for its thick, perfect hollow tubes. It‚Äôs only been a few decades since American surf enthusiasts brought their boards to the Philippines, but our beaches have really taken to surf culture. As they should. They‚Äôve got water and waves to spare.

Fun Fact: 
International surfers call Cloud 9's perfect tubes as "the special wave." The wave was discovered by traveling surfers in the late 1980s. It was named and made famous by American photographer John S. Callahan.

Photo by/Author: 
Tourism Department Philippines/Donna Dimayuga
comments: Jovz Salgado lets go there and get surfing! ;)$$been there.its an amazing place

message+desc:
End your work week with a bowl of this steaming batchoy, a Filipino noodle soup made up of chicken broth, pork strips, crushed pork cracklings and topped with lots of garlic! Any idea which city this popular dish originated in? Type your guesses below!  

Photo from rapsa.ph
comments: Bacolod. And its yummy$$well,,no other than from iloilo city, Lapaz batchoy,$$La Paz district, Iloilo City, Iloilo. I miss that place!  You eat it with puto they sell. The largest size and the chicken batchoy to me is the best! :P$$Lapaz Iloilo City ,the original Lapaz batsoy....$$La Paz batchoy originated in La Paz, Iloilo. Hmmmm... I miss that... :-/$$Batchoy  and originated in iloilo.$$Iloilo. Did you know that normally and originally Batchoy is served without egg, it is served hot just straight up, a must to eat with local Manapla puto. Asking for caldo is also free. I don't eat Batchoy in malls, my family always eat it at tienda La Paz which is wayyyy good! Can't compare. The Original Decos in tienda La Paz is not franchised and still owned by the original owners. I'm not a fan of eggs in my batchoy. Eggs for me boiled or raw is for Arroz Caldo. Btw, true blue Ilongga. :-)

message+desc:
Where is it? 
Coron, Palawan

What is it like? 
It‚Äôs a 30-minute hike up a limestone hill before you can reach this popular photo-op peak in Coron. From this spot, a downhill trek to the other side will lead you to the majestic Cayangan Lake ‚Äî best known for its underwater caves.

Fun Fact: 
The captivating shot of islets in a bay that forms the final scene of The Bourne Legacy was shot in Palawan.

Photo by/Author: 
Tourism Department Philippines/Jao Bautista

message+desc:
Introduced in popular Korean Variety Show "Running Man", the Mabijeong Mural village in Daegu is presently home to 35 functioning households. There are several "R" flags around the village as they were left as it is after the filming. Try spotting them when you are here! :3

Add: Mabijeong, Bonli2-ri, Hwawon-eup, Dalseong-gun, Daegu

How to get there?
Get off at Daegok station (Daegu Subway Line 1) and Exit 1.
Walk straight until you reach the bus stop and board Dalseong 2(Îã¨ÏÑ±2) bus. Get off at Bonli2-ri the bus stop.

#RunningMan #FilmingLocation #Îü∞ÎãùÎß® #Ï¥¨ÏòÅÏßÄ #VisitKorea

Here's one :D$$I know this!!! as a fan of Running Man and Korea/KTO here \(n_n)/ would be glad to visit Mabijeong Mural village in Daegu and find "R" flags...it feels like i'm part of Running Man doing the missions... ^,^$$Cheng Teng is this the same mural village we talk abt previously?$$Also adding this that I screencap in the Kdrama of HyunBin - Hyde, Jekyll & I is Kim Gwangseok Street (colorful murals related to the songs/life of the late singer) which is in Daebong-dong, Jung-gu, Daegu.$$As a Running Man fan and also a mural village fan, adding this to the many mural villages for me to explore in Korea. Done with Ihwa in Seoul and Gamcheon in Busan. :-)$$My memory is really bad. I can't remember this place. ): I'll find the episode and re-watch. Haha.

message+desc:
Have you experience a picturesque sun setting backdrop view while enjoying classical favourites and contemporary tunes at the tip of Borneo?

Sunset Music Festival takes place in the northern-most district of Kudat. Sabah‚Äôs biggest open air concert featuring a line-up of local and international acts performing a broad repertoire of music.

Tanjung Simpang Mengayau is popularly known as the Tip of Borneo as it is in fact the meeting point of the South China Sea and Sulu Sea. White sandy stretches of beach and the brilliant azure colour of the ocean has earned this place the reputation as one of the most spectacular destinations in Sabah.

To get to Kudat: about 3 hours drive by Car from Kota Kinabalu, capital city of Sabah.
comments:
I just came back from Sabah kk
If not for mahathia who let in all the refugees ! Sabah is so peaceful and beautiful .$$I wish to see that beautiful place..$$Sory I never go there before !$$Went there twice.. Luv it soo much... Wish to b there again..!

message+desc: You can meet adorable penguins by forking out a fortune for a stomach-churning sea crossing to the freezing Antarctic. Or you could take a cheaper and smoother ride on bus 629 to Ocean Park and its Polar Adventure. See snowy owls, arctic foxes, walruses, Aurora Borealis and more, all within the comfort of the tropics. http://bit.ly/MYbxus
comments: Loved Ocean park the Pandas especially adorable.  Liked the Japanese Garden as well such a peacefull little corner of the Park.

message+desc:
Our elders know how good we have it.Life may not be that easy for them, but most of the aunties and uncles we talked to in Chinatown said even if they were given a choice, they wouldn't mind living in Singapore for the rest of their lives.

In fact, some of them said life in Singapore was pretty good.
comments: Maybe the younger generation think otherwise. The pampered ones who never suffer hard times.$$Only u been through the era of difficult years, u sure can see n feel the difference.$$If given a chance i wld like to stay and live in Singapore..provided i have the means..$$if there is a choice, NO$$Yes, they have so many choices after all.
